name: 3-Ingredient Cereal Bars
ingredients: ½cup smooth natural peanut butter (like Smucker's Natural)
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at how to make this recipe so you know what to expect. Scroll down to the end of the post for the full recipe.
2. Line an 8×8-inch baking sheet with parchment paper, leaving a 2-inch overhang on two sides (which will make it easy to lift the bars out when it's time to slice them).
3. Add the peanut butter and honey to a large heat-safe bowl. Warm in the microwave for 15-30 seconds, or until easy to stir. (This may not be necessary if you keep your peanut butter and honey at room temperature.) Stir together to combine.
4. Add the cereal and vanilla, if using, to the bowl. Stir gently, but thoroughly, using a wooden spoon or spatula. It may take a minute or two to get the mixture evenly coated.
5. Press mixture into the prepared baking pan, gently pressing evenly and into the corners.
6. Chill for at least 20 minutes. Remove from the fridge, lift out using the parchment paper, and slice on a cutting board.
7. Wrap each bar in plastic wrap (optional) and store in an airtight container in the fridge. Serve cold.

name: Aloo Corn Tikki Roll
instructions:
1. Boil and mash potatoes (peel and quarter, steam in IP for 8 min)
2. Fresh pan: saute oil, ginger, garlic, green chilies
3. Add ketchup (3 tbsp), turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala
4. Saute for 30 seconds
5. Add ¼ cup water and stir thoroughly
6. Cook for a minute
7. Add frozen corn kernels (½ cup), mashed potatoes (1 cup), salt, amchur powder
8. Mash and combine well
9. Add fresh coriander and let cool
10. Start rotimatic for chapathis
11. Shape into patty form and grill on both sides (high heat with minimal oil, add breadcrumbs if the patty won’t hold shape easily)
12. Make red sauce: curd, red chili powder, garlic juice, black salt
13. Make green sauce: curd (½ cup), mint chutney (2 tbsp)
14. Spread ghee on chapathi, add both sauces, chopped red onion and frankie masala
15. Add patty with a couple drops of vinegar and roll up

name: Apple Cinnamon Carrot Muffin
instructions:
1. Shred apples to get 1 1/2 cup for recipe, squeeze out extra moisture.Shred carrot to get 1/2 cup for recipe, squeeze out extra moisture.
2. Preheat over to 350 degrees and prepare muffin tins
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine dry ingredients. Mix in apples and carrots until well combined.
4. In a small bowl, combine wet ingredients. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix to incorporate ingredients.
5. Spoon into muffin tins. Bake for approximately 16 minutes or until atoothpick/knife inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Arisi Upma Mix
instructions:
1. Soak one cup of basmati rice and 3-4 teaspoons of toor dal for 10 min
2. Wash it and strain the water completely
3. Towel dry for one hour
4. Grind it in Preethi mixer to coarse consistency and store in glass jar in fridge
5. When ready to use...
6. Heat coconut oil or canola+ghee mixedAdd mustard, urad dhal, jeera, asoeftida and wait for crackle
7. For every half cup of mix, add 1.5 cups of water.
8. Add salt and fresh coconut to taste
9. Keep stirring until cooked, adding water if needed

name: Baked Black Bean and Sweet Potato Flautas
instructions:
1. Pre-heat your oven to 425F.
2. Poke a few holes in your sweet potato, wrap it in a slightly damp paper towel, and microwave on high for about 6-8 minutes. The paper towel trick keeps the potato moist
3. While you wait, combine corn, diced or minced peppers, and diced or minced onion with your black beans, garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, cilantro, cayenne, and taco sauce/salsa.
4. If you prefer very tender veggies, feel free to saute the vegetables first in a little butter or oil to tenderize.
5. Your cayenne and red pepper flakes will control the spice-factor; adjust those to taste.
6. I alternate between using my favorite flavorful red enchilada sauce, spicy taco sauce, and a natural, zesty salsa like Mrs. Renfros Green Salsa, all have produced delicious results!
7. Once your sweet potato is cooked, fluff the inside with a fork and add the flesh [minus the skin] to the rest of your veggies and mix thoroughly.
8. Add salt, pepper, and any additional seasoning to taste. I usually add a little extra sprinkle chili powder, cumin, and garlic!
9. Next, working in small batches of maybe 3-4 tortillas, wrap corn tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave on high for 30 seconds. Follow it up with an additional 30 seconds, if needed.
10. The goal here is to steam the tortillas so they roll into perfect flautas without breaking or cracking =) This trick works like a charm!
11. Immediately spray or rub one side each tortilla with oil and add "line" of veggie filling to the center of the "dry side" of each tortilla, about 1-inch thick.
12. Top it off with a layer of cheese [as much or as little as you want! if you're using cream cheese as well you can mix it into the shredded cheese before topping] and roll the tortilla.
13. Place on a wire baking/cooling rack and seal with a toothpick, if needed.
14. Repeat these steps until you have a rack full of flautas.
15. Give them one more teeny spritz of olive oil to get them extra crispy [no-frying! whoo!] and set the rack baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
16. The wire rack elevates the flautas and allows them to get nice and crispy on both sides. If you don't own a wire rack, simply place the flautas on aluminum foil after spraying and turn over halfway through cooking so both sides will get a chance to crisp up. Uber easy!
17. Bake on the middle rack, at 425F, for 15 minutes.
18. At the end, set to broil on HIGH for just under a minute to crisp the tortillas into a perfectly golden, crunchy shell.
19. Pile high with any + all veggies you have on hand and serve with plain greek yogurt, salsa, and guacamole for dipping! You can even whip up a small bowl of jalapeno ranch for dunking too! If you have any fresh lime or cilantro both will make a tasty garnish!

name: Balsamic Bruschetta
ingredients: 1 loaf French bread, cut into ¼-inch slices
instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.
2. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
3. Brush bread slices on both sides lightly with 1 tablespoon oil and place on large baking sheet. Toast bread until golden, about 5 to 10 minutes, turning halfway through.
4. Meanwhile, toss together tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic in a bowl.
5. Mix in balsamic vinegar, 2 teaspoons olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper.
6. Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted bread slices.
7. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Banana Bread Muffins
instructions:
1. Preheat over to 350 degrees and prepare muffin tins
2. In a bowl, mash bananas, then mix in cinnamon, maple syrup and vanilla.
3. Pour mixture into a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth andreturn to the bowl.
4. Add egg, yogurt and milk. Mix until combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda and baking powder.
6. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until fully combined.
7. Pour batter into muffin tins and bake for ~15 minutes.

name: Beans Poriyal
instructions:
1. Chop beans to appropriate size.
2. Temper: oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves.
3. Add beans, sauté for 2 minutes in medium flame
4. Add sambar powder, turmeric and salt.
5. Sprinkle 3-4 tablespoon water and cook covered for 4-5 minutes.
6. Lastly add the grated coconut and stir once, remove from fire.

name: Best Ever Banana Nut Muffins
instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and prepare a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners (or grease very well with butter or cooking spray if you prefer not to use paper liners).
2. Mash the bananas in a large bowl and mix in the sugar and egg with a wooden spoon until well blended.
3. Add the vegetable oil and mix well.
4. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg, along with 3/4 cup of the chopped walnuts. Adding the walnuts with the dry ingredients helps prevent over-mixing.
5. Mix everything together just until the flour disappears and the walnuts are distributed evenly throughout the batter.
6. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 3/4 cup walnuts, brown sugar and melted butter and mix until the walnuts are coated.
7. Spoon the muffin batter evenly into the 12 muffin cups and spoon a bit of the coated walnuts onto the top of each one, making sure the topping is well distributed onto the top of each muffin (not in one big clump or it might sink into the muffin as it bakes!).
8. Bake for about 20-23 minutes, or until the muffins are golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted into the center of one of the muffins comes out clean.
9. Let the muffins cool in their tins for a few minutes before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Bhel Puri Chaat
instructions:
1. Roast peanuts.
2. Chop up veggies.
3. Add spices and mix well.
4. Add chutneys, lemon juice and cilantro. Mix well to distribute.
5. Serve with puffed rice, sev and peanuts.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
instructions:
1. This recipe is for 4 adult lunch servings
2. Prep:Rinse 1 cup toor dal and 2 cups rice well.
3. Chop onions, tomatoes, carrots, beans, potatoes, and gather other ingredients.
4. Cook:Set the Instant Pot to ‘Sauté’ mode. Add 2 tbsp ghee, then mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, dried red chilies, and cashews. Sauté for 30 seconds.
5. Add onions and tomatoes, sauté until soft.
6. Then add all chopped vegetables. Mix in turmeric, salt, and 4 tbsp Bisi Bele Bath powder. Stir for 30 seconds.
7. Add rinsed toor dal and rice, followed by 8 cups water and 2 tbsp tamarind pulp. Mix well.
8. Cancel ‘Sauté’ mode, close the lid, and set Instant Pot to ‘Pressure Cook’ on HIGH for 10 minutes.
9. Allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes, then manually release the remaining pressure.
10. Open the lid, stir well, and adjust consistency by adding a little hot water if needed.

name: Black Bean Brownie Bites
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 24-cup mini muffin tin with paper liners.
2. Add the oil and chocolate chips to a heat-safe bowl. Warm in the microwave for 1 minute. Remove from microwave and stir together until the chocolate and oil are blended together.
3. Add the chocolate-oil mixture to a food processor with the rest of the ingredients except the flour. Blend well.
4. Pulse in the flour.
5. Divide the batter among the muffin cups, using a heaping tablespoon in each. Flatten a bit with a spoon and add sprinkles if desired.
6. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until firm to the touch. Let cool fully before serving.

name: Black Bean Quinoa Salad
instructions:
1. Cook 1/2 cup quinoa
2. In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, lime juice, cumin, cilantro and scallions.
3. In a large bowl, mix together quinoa, black beans, tomato and bell peppers. Pour dressing over quinoa mixture and mix well.
4. Add feta, salt and pepper if desired, to taste.

name: Blackberries
instructions: 1. Wash and serve.

name: Blueberry Chocolate Chip Muffin
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees and prep muffin tins
2. Mix milk with 2 tsp of vinegar and let it sit for a few minutes
3. Peel sweet potato and grate (only use 3/4 cup of shredded SP in recipe).
4. In a large mixing bowl, mix flours, baking power, baking soda, salt andsugar in a large mixing bowl.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, mix avocado oil, eggs, milk mixture, vanilla and sweet potato until smooth.
6. Pour liquid ingredients into dry ingredients. Stir until just mixed. Do not over mix.
7. Add blueberries and chocolate chips.
8. Pour into muffin tins.
9. Bake for 16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Cool before eating or freezing.

name: Blueberry Date Oatmeal
instructions:
1. In a microwave-safe bowl, mix oats, cauliflower, milk and dates.
2. Microwave on high for approximately 6 minutes. Alternately, cook on stovetop, stirring frequently.
3. Stir in blueberries and coconut oil before serving

name: Broccoli Spinach Pasta Sauce
instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil.Add the broccoli florets and cook for about 4 minutes, until tender.Use a slotted spoon to remove the broccoli and transfer it to a blender. Keep this water for the pasta.
2. Add spinach, broth, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, salt, garlic powder.Blend until the mixture is smooth.
3. In the same pot of boiling water used for the broccoli, add the pasta.Cook according to the package instructions until al dente.Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
4. Pour the broccoli cheese sauce over the cooked pasta.Stir well to ensure the pasta is thoroughly coated with the sauce.Top with grated Parmesan cheese and cracked black pepper, if desired.

name: Butternut Squash Mac and Cheese
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at how to make this easy butternut squash mac and cheese recipe. Scroll down to the bottom of the post for the full recipe, including the amounts and timing.
2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the squash until tender. Transfer to a blender using a slotted spoon. (Leave the water in the pot since you will use it for the pasta!)
3. Add the milk, butter, and cheese. Blend super smooth.
4. Cook the pasta in the same pot of water. Drain it.
5. Stir the sauce into the pasta and serve.
6. Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
7. Add the squash and cook for about 10 minutes or until soft when poked with a fork. Use a large slotted spoon to transfer the squash to a blender, draining off all of the liquid.
8. Add the milk, cheese, and butter to the blender with the squash and puree until completely smooth.
9. Meanwhile, bring the water back to a boil and cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to the pot.
10. Stir in the cheese sauce, season to taste with salt, and serve warm.

name: Caramel Delight Energy Balls
ingredients: 6 tablespoons mini semisweet chocolate chips, divided
instructions:
1. Stir oats, almond butter, caramel sauce, salt, 3 tablespoons chocolate chips and 3 tablespoons coconut in a medium bowl until combined.
2. Roll the mixture into balls, using a heaping tablespoon for each, and place on a parchment-paper-lined baking sheet.
3. Cook the remaining 3 tablespoons coconut in a skillet over medium heat, stirring often, until toasted and golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a shallow bowl.
4. Place the remaining 3 tablespoons chocolate chips in a small microwaveable bowl; microwave on High for 30 seconds. Stir until smooth. Microwave for another 30 seconds if necessary. Spoon the melted chocolate into a small plastic bag; snip off a tiny tip of 1 corner of the bag. Drizzle the chocolate over the balls; roll in the toasted coconut. Let stand until the chocolate is set.

name: Carrot Cake Bars
instructions:
1. Grate carrot and mash a ripe banana.
2. Preheat oven 180c⁣
3. In a prepared loaf tin, mix together the wet ingredients (banana, egg, peanut butter, maple syrup, carrot) and then the remaining ingredients. Mix well.⁣
4. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean ⁣

name: Carrot Poriyal
instructions:
1. Wash carrots, remove the outer skin, grate it and keep aside.
2. Heat oil in a kadai, add mustard seeds, urad dal and let it splutter.
3. Add curry leaves and fry for a min.
4. Add green chillies and saute for 2mins.
5. Now add onion, required salt and saute well till it is transparent.
6. Then add grated carrots.
7. Saute till it shrinks mins then sprinkle little water and cook covered till it turns soft and raw smell leaves. You can omit water and cook covered too.
8. Once it becomes dry add coconut, give a quick stir and switch off.
9. Switch off and serve Carrot Poriyal with sambar rice or any variety rice.

name: Cauliflower Alfredo Sauce
instructions:
1. Put all ingredients into a medium pot and bring to a complete boil, then cover and simmer 15 minutes or until the cauliflower is fall-apart tender.
2. Pulverize with either an immersion or regular blender.
3. Serve over pasta, or spaghetti squash, rice, roasted vegetables, or whatever you wish.
4. Makes about 2 cups, and it gets much thicker as it sits.

name: Cauliflower Rasam
instructions:
1. Boil florets with a little salt in hot water.
2. Drain when half done.
3. Immerse in water with salt, turmeric, 1 tomato and cilantro
4. While that boils, keep paruppu.
5. Grind coconut, green chili, half tomato, cumin, cilantro into paste
6. Add paruppu jelam and simmer for ten minutes.
7. Add tadka with ghee, cumin and mustard seeds.
8. Add lemon juice just before serving.

name: Chana Masala (IP)
instructions:
1. Chop 1 large onion and 2 tomatoes (or 1 can of diced tomatoes). Drain and rinse 2 cans of chickpeas.
2. Turn on the Instant Pot and select the 'Sauté' function.
3. Add 2 tablespoons of ghee and let it heat up.
4. Add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
5. Add the finely chopped onions to the Instant Pot and sauté until golden brown.
6. Add the minced garlic, ginger, and green chilies (if using). Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
7. Add the chopped tomatoes (or canned diced tomatoes) and cook until they become soft and the oil starts to separate from the mixture.
8. Stir in the ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, paprika, and chili powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.
9. Add the drained and rinsed chickpeas to the Instant Pot. Mix well to coat the chickpeas with the spice mixture.
10. Add about 1 cup of water to the Instant Pot. Stir well.
11. Secure the lid on the Instant Pot, making sure the valve is set to 'Sealing'.
12. Select the 'Manual' or 'Pressure Cook' function and set the timer for 5 minutes.
13. Once the cooking cycle is complete, let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, then carefully turn the valve to 'Venting' to release any remaining pressure.
14. Open the Instant Pot and sprinkle 1 teaspoon of garam masala over the chana masala. Stir well and adjust salt to taste.

name: Cheddar and Spinach Muffins
instructions:
1. PrepWash the Spinach Leaves and place on a tea towel or paper towel to remove the extra water.Chop spinach. Make egg substitute. Grate cheddar cheese.
2. CookPreheat your oven on 180'C/350'F and grease a Muffin Pan with Oil or Butter.
3. In a large bowl, beat the Eggs then add the Sour Cream, Olive Oil, Full Cream Milk and Minced Garlic. Stir until combined.
4. Stir in the Grated Cheddar Cheese.
5. Add the Plain Flour, Baking Powder, Salt, Pepper, Ground Cumin (see note 2). Whisk until combined.
6. Add the finely chopped Spinach and fold in with a spatula.
7. Optional: sprinkle some extra grated Cheddar over the muffins for more cheesiness!
8. Pour the muffin batter into a Muffin pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

name: Cheese and Tomato Quinoa Balls
instructions:
1. Grate cheddar cheese. Heat water for broth.
2. Chop tomatoes and measure out. Make egg substitute.
3. Preheat oven to 350F
4. In a bowl soak the quinoa in water. Chop onion, tomatoes, basil. Grate the cheddar.
5. Heat oil, over medium heat, in a pan and gently sauté the onions and garlic until the onions become translucent. Around 5 mins.
6. Using a fine-mesh sieve, drain and thoroughly rinse the quinoa.
7. To the onions and garlic, add the tomatoes, stock, quinoa and stir. Bring to the boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and allow to simmer for 15 mins.
8. Turn the heat off and leave the quinoa to sit covered for a further 5 mins.
9. Stir in the cheddar cheese & basil.
10. Allow to cool and then stir in the beaten egg.
11. Form heaped tablespoon sized balls.
12. Bake in the oven for 25 mins or until golden.

name: Cheesy Veggie Quesadilla
instructions:
1. Set a pan on a medium flame and add oil, garlic, onion, mixed bell pepper, corn, paneer, sweet chilli sauce, salt to taste, black pepper for seasoning, oregano and red chilli flakes
2. Mix well and cook for some time
3. In a fresh pan, add some oil, tortilla, veggie mixture and mozzarella.
4. Place an another tortilla over it and cook from both the sides as shown in the video
5. Cut it using pizza cutter and serve with mayo dip

name: Chef’s Paniyaram
instructions:
1. Saute onion until caramelized.Turn off heat and add chopped cilantroOnce cooled, add batter and mix.Add more batter because you'll want a lot more.
2. Add oil to kuzhiAdd battercover for 2 minutes on mediumflip over using spoonscover and cook again for 1 minute
3. Scoop out and enjoy

name: Cherry Tomato Salad
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, agave, garlic, salt, and pepper.
2. Add the tomatoes and the oregano and toss to combine. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.

name: Chickpea Chaat Salad
instructions:
1. Grate carrotDice onion, bell pepper, cucumber, tomatoChop and toast peanuts
2. Place chickpeas, onion, bell pepper, cucumber, tomato, carrot, red chilli, coriander and mint in a large bowl. Toss and mix well.
3. Prepare the dressing by mixing olive oil, sriracha, lemon juice, garlic, cumin powder, chaat masala, tamarind paste, salt.
4. When ready to serve, add the dressing to the salad in the bowl. Toss and mix well to coat everything evenly with the dressing.
5. Top with peanuts and extra cilantro

name: Chocolate Banana Bark
ingredients: ½cup chocolate chips, I used Lily's dark chocolate chips
instructions:
1. Line a small baking sheet with parchment paper. Add banana slices to the parchment in rows to make a rectangle shape. You want to make sure all your banana slices are touching.
2. Use a spoon to spread peanut butter over the banana slices to make a peanut butter layer. Pop the baking sheet into the freezer for about 20 minutes to let the bananas and peanut butter harden a bit.
3. Place chocolate chips and the coconut oil into a microwave safe bowl and melt in the microwave in 30 second increments, stirring between each. It shouldn't take longer than 1-2 minutes total.
4. Drizzle melted chocolate over top of the peanut butter and use a spoon or spread the chocolate into a thin layer. Sprinkle on the flaky sea salt and place back in the freezer until chocolate has set, about 20 minutes or so.
5. Remove from the freezer, break or cut into pieces and enjoy! Store any leftover bark in the freezer for up to a month.

name: Chocolate Banana Lentil Muffins (REW)
instructions:
1. Cook lentils
2. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
3. Blend oats, flour, baking soda, and cinnamon. Transfer to mixing bowl.
4. Puree lentils and oil.  Add bananas, sugar, vanilla, and egg and process until smooth
5. Pour liquid mixture into dry mixture. Mix until just incorporated. (If adding chocolate chips to muffins, add here.)
6. Put 3 chocolate chips into the bottom of each muffin cup.
7. Scoop muffin batter into each muffin cup. Press a chocolate chip into the top.
8. Bake for approximately 20 minutes

name: Chocolate Chip Mini Muffins (Little Bites Copycat)
ingredients: ¼cup unsalted butter (melted and slightly cooled)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Stir together the wet ingredients.
3. Stir together the dry ingredients, then mix in the wet. Add the chocolate chips.
4. Divide among a greased mini muffin pan.
5. Bake! These muffins bake quickly, so set that timer and avoid over baking for the best results.
6. Use a small knife to help transfer the cooked muffins to a wire rack to cool fully. (Note that I do not recommend using paper cupcake liners with these as they will likely stick. Nonstick spray is a better option.)
7. AD
8. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 24-cup mini muffin pan with nonstick spray.
9. In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
10. In another bowl, stir together the yogurt, maple syrup, eggs, butter, and vanilla.
11. Gently stir the yogurt mixture into the flour mixture.
12. Stir in the chocolate chips.
13. Divide batter among the prepared muffin tin, filling about to the edge. (You'll use about 1 ½ tablespoon in each mini muffin cup.)
14. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden brown and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out cleanly. Do not over bake.
15. Remove from oven, and let cool in the pan for 2 minutes. Run a paring knife around the edges to loosen, if needed, then carefully transfer muffins to a wire rack to cool fully.

name: Chocolate Protein Muffins (with Veggies!)
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease the muffin tin.
2. Place all ingredients into a blender and blend until very smooth.
3. Fill muffin cups about ½ full using about ¼ cup batter in each. Top with chocolate chips, if using.
4. Bake 20 minutes for regular muffins and 12 for mini muffins.
5. Let cool for 5-10 minutes in the pan, run a knife around the edges, and carefully transfer to a wire rack to cool.

name: Chow Chow Kootu
instructions:
1. Peel and dice chow chow.
2. Add moong dal, turmeric, sambar powder and salt.
3. Add a cup of water and make sure everything is mixed together
4. Put in IP for 8 minutes manual mode and then natural pressure release. Full process should take 20 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, mix rice flour into a small amount of water.
6. Grind coconut with the rice flour mixture well.
7. Add a little jeera and grind coarsely.
8. (Finely chop small onions if you have time)
9. By now, pressure should have release, so add the mixture to cooked vegetables and bring to boil in saute mode.
10. Thalichify with coconut oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves. Add finely chopped small onion and mix well.

name: Cilantro Lime Crema
ingredients: 1cupwhole milk Greek yogurt or sour cream
instructions:
1. In a food processor, place the yogurt, mayo, lime juice, garlic, salt, and onion powder. Process until creamy.
2. Add the cilantro and pulse until the sauce is smooth but green flecks are still visible. Season to taste.

name: Corn & Black Bean Dip TCL
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
2. Cook the corn in microwave.
3. Dice bell peppers, serranos, scallions.
4. Melt 1 tbsp oil and 2 tablespoon of the butter in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat and add the diced serranos/jalapenos and let splutter for a few seconds then add the red and green peppers.
5. Add pinch of salt and cook, stirring occasionally, on medium to low heat until the peppers are softened (about 7-8 minutes).
6. Prep the oven safe dish and aluminum foil.
7. Add the corn, garlic, red chili, cumin powder, oregano and stir to incorporate well. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to let the corn mix with the spices and soften a bit. Add Black beans, cilantro, siracha, stir and remove from heat. Add mayonnaise (or sour cream substitute), milk, and shredded cheese and mix well.
8. Transfer to oven safe baking dish, cover with foil and let bake for 20 minutes on the middle rack until you see the edges of the dip bubbling.
9. Remove from oven, top with scallions and serve hot with tortilla chips! If you want to get a golden brown crust on top - add an additional layer of shredded cheese on top and broil on low for a few minutes until the cheese has browned.

name: Cowboy Caviar Salad
ingredients: 1(15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the dressing ingredients.
2. Cook corn in microwave.
3. Add all of the salad ingredients to a large bowl and drizzle the dressing on top.
4. Enjoy! Serve plain or as a dip for tortilla chips. Optionally, refrigerate 10 - 15 minutes before serving to let the flavors marinate.

name: Crackers and Cheese Cubes
instructions: 1. Serve crackers with cheese cubes.

name: Creamy Macaroni Pasta Salad
ingredients: 8 ounces salad macaroni or ditalini pasta
instructions:
1. Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package, adding a generous tablespoon or so of kosher salt to the water as it cooks. Just before the noodles are done cooking, add the broccoli to the pot. Let the broccoli boil for about 30 seconds and then drain everything into a large colander. Rinse well with cold water.
2. Stir together the mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, pepper, and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add the cooked pasta and broccoli to the bowl and stir well to coat. Add the cucumber, pepper, olives, and onions and stir again. Taste and adjust seasonings, if needed. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Stir again just before serving. Enjoy!

name: Crispy Chipotle Sweet Potato Tacos with Lime Crema
instructions:
1. Peel and cube the sweet potatoes.Seed and chop the poblano.
2. Preheat the oven to 425° F.
3. Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and toss with olive oil, chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, oregano, and salt.
4. Add the poblano and toss to combine.
5. Arrange in an even layer.
6. Bake 35 to 40 minutes, until the potatoes are tender and beginning to char on the edges.
7. Remove from the oven and stir in the black beans.
8. Meanwhile, make the crema.
9. Combine all ingredients in a glass jar and shake or stir until creamy.
10. Line the taco shells up on a sheet pan or in a 9×13 inch baking dish.
11. Transfer to the oven and bake 5 minutes. Evenly divide the sweet potatoes among each taco shell and top with cheese.
12. Bake 10 minutes, until the cheese has melted.
13. Mix the cilantro and jalapeño in a small bowl. Serve the tacos topped with crema, avocado, and the spicy cilantro. Enjoy!

name: Cucumber Cream Cheese Bagel
instructions:
1. Slice and toast bagel.
2. Spread both sides with cream cheese.
3. Top on side with cucumber slices.
4. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

name: Cucumber Sandwiches
instructions:
1. Peel the cucumber in stripes and cut into 1/8-inch thin slices using a mandolin or sharp knife. Place the slices on paper towels and sprinkle with coarse salt. Let rest for 15-30 minutes to extract moisture. Pat dry with clean paper towels.
2. In the meantime, make the spread. In a medium bowl, using a handheld mixer, blend together the softened cream cheese, mayo, dill, chives, lemon juice, garlic powder, and salt.
3. Spread one side of each slice of bread with the herbed cream cheese.
4. Layer cucumber slices over half of the bread slices. Season with fresh cracked black pepper, to taste. Top with remaining bread slices, cream cheese mixture down. (At this point, you'll have 8 full sandwiches.)
5. Using a sharp Chef's knife, cut each sandwich into quarters, pushing through the bread down to the bottom. So you have 32 tea sandwiches.
6. Serve right away and enjoy!
7. To Make Ahead“One day before, the sandwiches were made and cut and layered with damp doubled paper towels in a fish bin (or on a sheet pan, and then saran wrapped) and refrigerated.”

name: Curried Cauliflower Quinoa Salad
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F.
2. Cook the quinoa. Dice all the cucumbers.
3. In a large bowl toss cauliflower with olive oil, desired spices (cumin, coriander, etc) and salt. Spread onto a baking sheet in a single layer and bake on center rack for 40 minutes.
4. While the cauliflower is cooking prepare the salad dressing by combining yogurt, tahini, cucumber, oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt in a blender and blending until smooth.
5. In a large bowl toss together cooked quinoa, red cabbage and arugula and divide between 4 bowls.
6. Top each bowl with fresh cilantro, cucumbers, golden raisins and roasted cauliflower.
7. Drizzle with yogurt tahini dressing and enjoy!

name: Curried Egg Salad Sandwich
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together all of the ingredients except the eggs.
2. Add in the boiled chopped eggs, mix together well and serve!
3. Great on a croissant, between bread or on enjoy on crackers for a great snack.

name: Date Cookies
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and place parchment paper on cookie sheets.
2. Put dates and butter in a food processor. Process until smooth.
3. Add egg, Greek yogurt and vanilla to the food processor. Mix thoroughly.
4. Take a new bowl and mix buckwheat flour, white whole wheat flour, oats, baking soda, and cinnamon.
5. Add liquid ingredients to dry ingredients and mix fully.
6. Use ice cream scooper to make small balls of dough. Place on greased cookie sheets and press down on the top.
7. Bake 12-15 min - until lightly brown.

name: Dry Paneer Masala
ingredients: 1.5 cups finely diced onions (1 large red onion)
1cupdiced red bell pepper (cut into large squares)
1cupdiced green bell pepper (cut into large squares)
instructions:
1. In a large pot over medium high heat add the oil. Once the oil is hot add the cumin seeds and let them splutter for a few seconds.
2. Add the diced onions and cook on medium heat for about 10 minutes until the onions are golden. I like to add a pinch of salt to the onions to help them cook faster.
3. Now add the garlic, ginger, and all the spices except for Kasuri methi, red bell peppers, green bell peppers and mix well. Stir this for about 2 minutes so everything has a chance to mix well and then add 1/2 cup of water , mix well and place a lid on the pot. Reduce heat to low and let this cook covered for about 10 minutes.
4. Remove the lid and give everything a good mix and now add the cubed paneer, corn, cilantro, kasuri methi and salt. Stir and taste for salt- adjust as needed. Place a lid on the pot and let it cook for an additional 5 minutes!
5. Serve hot with paratha and or rice!

name: Easiest Animal Crackers
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at how to make this easy animal cookies recipe. Scroll down to the bottom of the post for the full recipe.
2. AD
3. Add the ingredients to a bowl.
4. Mix together with a wooden spoon or your hands. Form a ball.
5. Roll out between parchment paper pieces, cut out with mini cookie cutters.
6. Bake and enjoy.
7. Best Tips for Success
8. I prefer to roll the dough out between parchment paper since it’s easy, but you can also do it by coating the rolling pin with a little flour to prevent sticking.
9. You can use all-purpose flour if you prefer or if that’s what you have. I like the flavor from whole-wheat, but both will work.
10. We like to make them using mini cookie cutters, but any size will work.
11. Store leftovers in an airtight container for 3-5 days at room temperature.
12. You can also store any dough you don’t use in a zip top plastic bag, tightly sealed and with as much air removed as possible, for up to a week in the fridge. Let sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before using.
13. AD
14. Preheat the oven to 375°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
15. Place all ingredients into a bowl and use your hand to mix together to form a dough. (If the dough is a little crumbly, be sure that it’s throughly combined and then if it’s still crumbly, add 1/2-1 tablespoon additional milk until it comes together.)
16. Make a flattened disc of dough.
17. Roll the dough ¼-inch thick between two pieces of lightly floured pieces of parchment paper. (The flour will ensure that the cut outs are easy to move.)
18. Cut out the dough with a cookie cutter and transfer to the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 7-9 minutes, until lightly browned around the edges.
19. Remove from the oven, let cool on the baking sheet for a minute, and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Easy Cheese Crackers
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cold butter (diced into small pieces)
instructions:
1. Add all ingredients to the food processor.
2. Blend until it sticks together into a batter. You may need to pulse it a few times, as the mixture is a thick batter.
3. Roll out the dough between two pieces of parchment paper coated with a little flour to prevent it from sticking.
4. Use cookie cutters, a knife, or a pastry wheel to cut out crackers.
5. Place onto a parchment-lined baking sheet or use a silicone baking mat.
6. Bake until golden brown.
7. How to Keep Homemade Crackers Crisp
8. These crackers are best eaten soon after they come out of the oven—they small so good I don’t know how you’d resist!—but you can store them in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a day or two.
9. They start to soften as they sit, so if you’re worried about eating the whole batch, make half and store the rest of the dough in a zip-top bag in the fridge or freezer, and when ready to make more, bring the dough to room temp and bake!
10. How to Store
11. These crackers are best eaten on the day they’re made, but you can store them in an airtight container at room temperature for a day or two.
12. Best Tips for Success
13. To make these gluten-free, use gluten-free flour blend and certified gluten-free rolled oats.
14. Use the rosemary to add a little extra flavor, or omit it if you prefer. Or try garlic powder or black pepper for other flavor variations.
15. If your dough is sticky at any point, place it into the fridge for a few minutes to firm up. If your dough seems to not come together when it’s in the food processor, add a few additional drops of milk.
16. Set the timer for the lower end of the baking range to start, then add another minute until the edges are lightly golden brown. The edges can get very brown really fast at the end.
17. To make a smaller batch, place half of the dough into a freezer storage bag, seal, and freeze for up to 3 months. Thaw at room temperature, roll out, cut out shapes, and bake whenever the urge strikes!
18. You may also like my go-to Store-Bought Snacks.
19. Dairy-free: Use nondairy cheese and softened coconut oil in place of the cheese and butter.
20. Gluten-free: Use a 1:1 style of gluten-free flour blend like the one from King Arthur Flour.
21. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
22. Add all ingredients to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse a few times to grind, then blend for 15-20 seconds until dough comes together.
23. Form the dough into a disc. Dust a piece of parchment with flour, place the dough on top, and add another piece of parchment to cover.
24. Roll out until ¼ inch thick. Cut with small cookie cutters and place on the prepared baking sheet. Re-roll and cut remaining dough until completed.
25. (If your milk, cheese, and butter are cold the dough should be easy to roll out between parchment paper. If the dough seems too sticky, stick it into the fridge for 5-10 minutes.)
26. Bake 14-16 minutes or until crackers are golden. Cool for a few minutes on a wire rack before serving.
27. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 days at room temperature.

name: Easy Chickpea Fritters
ingredients: 14.5- ounce can chickpeas (rinsed and drained; sometimes called garbanzo beans)
¼cup grated Parmesan cheese (or nutritional yeast to make dairy-free)
Cucumber-yogurt sauce, tzatziki, or hummus for serving
instructions:
1. Below is a preview of how to make this recipe so you know what to expect from the process. Scroll down to the end of the post for the full recipe, including the amounts and the timing.
2. Drain the chickpeas (I save the liquid for an egg replacer to use in baking). Rinse with cold water (this removes some of the sodium).
3. Add to a shallow dish or bowl with the rest of the ingredients except the olive oil.
4. Mash with a potato masher or fork until very smooth.
5. Form into round, flat patties using 1 tablespoon batter in each. Add olive oil to a pan or skillet over medium heat and cook the fritters until golden brown.
6. Drain the chickpeas (I save the liquid to use as an egg replacer in baking). Rinse with cold water (this removes some of the sodium).
7. Add to a shallow dish with the flour, Parmesan, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and 2 tablespoons water.
8. Mash with a potato masher until very smooth and uniform, adding another 2-4 tablespoons of water as needed.
9. Form into round, flat patties using 1 tablespoon batter in each. Patties should be about ½ inch thick.
10. Add olive oil to a pan over medium heat and cook the fritters for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
11. Place onto a paper towel to drain, if desired, and serve warm with desired dips.

name: Easy French Toast Sticks
instructions:
1. Cut bread into sticks.
2. Add the eggs, milk, and vanilla to a bowl. Dip bread in and coat all sides.
3. Cook in a nonstick pan. Flip. (You can also bake them or make them in the air fryer.)
4. Serve warm with optional toppings.
5. Cut bread into four sticks.
6. Add the eggs, milk, and vanilla to a wide, shallow bowl. Mix with a fork or a small whisk.
7. Dip each piece of bread into the egg mixture, turning over with a fork to coat all sides.
8. Add a sliver of butter to a nonstick pan to melt. Add batter-dipped sticks and cook for 3-4 minutes. Flip over to cook on the other side until golden brown.
9. Serve with cut fruit

name: Easy Fruit Snacks (Gummies)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Add the berries and carrots to a blender.
3. Puree smooth.
4. Add the berry mixture to a small pot set over low heat. Bring to a simmer.
5. Dissolve the gelatin. Whisk into the fruit mixture. Add to the mold and set.
6. AD
7. Add the berries, carrots, and water or juice to a blender. Puree smooth.
8. Add the berry mixture to a small pot set over low heat. Add the honey or maple syrup. Bring to a simmer.
9. (Plan to do this step and the next one quickly.) Add the gelatin to a bowl with ⅓ cup cold water. Stir well to completely dissolve the gelatin to ensure the fruit snacks are lump-free.
10. Working quickly, whisk the gelatin mixture into the simmering fruit mixture to thoroughly combine. Whisk constantly for a minute or two as the mixture starts to thicken. Turn off the heat.
11. (Alternatively, you can sprinkle the gelatin right over the simmering fruit and whisk vigorously to combine. Omit the water if you do that. Know you may have some small clumps of gelatin.)
12. Portion out into a silicone gummy bear mold (or other silicone mold) set on a small baking tray (which is more stable than the mold on its own). Refrigerate for at least an hour and up to overnight to set up.
13. Remove from the mold to serve.

name: Easy Homemade Granola Bars
ingredients: ½cup shredded unsweetened coconut (or use ½ cup additional oats)
¼cup honey (or maple syrup or applesauce)
3 tablespoons peanut butter (or sunflower seed butter or 1 egg)
¼cup water (or ¼ cup mashed ripe banana, pumpkin puree, applesauce, butternut squash puree, OR sweet potato puree)
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at the easy process involved in making this granola bar recipe. Scroll down to the bottom of this post for the full recipe.
2. Add ingredients to a food processor, choosing your flavor. Grind until the mixture starts to hold together.
3. Pour the batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and press flat.
4. Score the batter with a knife, which makes them easy to break into pieces once they’re baked.
5. Bake, let cool, and enjoy.
6. CAN I MAKE THESE WITHOUT CHIA SEEDS?
7. Sure! See the variation at the bottom that calls for omitting them and slightly increasing the nut butter. This keeps a good amount of healthy fats to ensure that the bars hold together and that the kids get a nicely balanced snack.
8. CAN I MAKE THESE GLUTEN-FREE GRANOLA BARS?
9. These bars are naturally egg-free and dairy-free. They’re also easy to make gluten-free by choosing gluten-free oats and a gluten-free flour blend.
10. HOW LONG DO THESE HEALTHY GRANOLA BARS LAST?
11. I store our homemade granola bars in the fridge (because I like them cold) in an airtight container and serve them up until we run out.
12. In the fridge in an airtight container, they’ll stay fresh for about two weeks.
13. At room temperature in an airtight container, they’ll last about 1 week.
14. In the freezer, you can place cooled bars in a sealed zip top freezer bag for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the fridge before serving.
15. CAN I FREEZE GRANOLA BARS?
16. Yes, this granola bar recipe freezes really well. Simply let them cool and place into a zip top freezer bag. Freeze for up to 3 months. Thaw in the fridge or at room temperature, or directly in a lunchbox.
17. Flavor Variations
18. I’m so happy that a reader suggested this because it works so well to use a fruit or veggie puree instead of water in the original recipe! I’ve tried making Applesauce Granola Bars, Banana Granola Bars, Butternut Squash, Sweet Potato, and Pumpkin Granola Bars.
19. Look in the Notes at the bottom of the recipe for the info.
20. Best Tips for Success
21. For kids under one, you can substitute brown rice syrup for the honey. You can also try using applesauce.
22. You can make them in the basic flavor, or banana, apple, sweet potato, butternut squash, or pumpkin.
23. To make these without coconut, omit and use additional oats.
24. To make these without chia seeds, omit and increase the nut butter to ¼ cup.
25. To make this without a food processor, use quick or instant oats and stir everything together. (Or grind the oats and coconut in a blender, then stir the ingredients together in a bowl)
26. Add chocolate chips to this recipe by pressing a few into the top of the rolled out batter just before baking.
27. Use room temperature honey and nut or seed butter to make the batter come together easily, or warm them briefly.
28. Wet your fingers or use a piece of parchment to press the batter down if it’s sticking to your hands.
29. You may also like No-Bake Granola Bars, Breakfast Bars, my Easy Oatmeal Bars, and my 3-Ingredient Cereal Bars.
30. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat. Warm the honey and peanut butter for about 15 seconds if not stored at room temperature.
31. Place the oats and coconut into the bowl of a food processor and blitz to grind into a coarse texture (similar to quick oats).
32. Add the remaining ingredients, including the peanut butter and honey, and blend well.
33. (You can also grind the oats or use instant oats, then mix everything together in a bowl.)
34. Add ¼ cup water and blend until batter comes together like thick cookie dough. You should be able to press the batter together between your fingers and have it stick together. If it doesn't, add a bit more water.
35. Place batter onto the center of the prepared baking sheet and use your hands to press thin, about ¼-½-inch thick and about 8x8-inches big. I measure roughly using an 8x8-inch baking pan. (You can also roll out the dough—just cover it with a piece of parchment paper first to make sure it's easy to do.) Use a knife to lightly score lines for squares in whatever size you like.
36. Bake for 18-20 minutes, remove from oven, and let cool completely on the pan.
37. Break into squares and serve.
38. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks in the fridge or a week at room temperature. To freeze, place cooled bars in a sealed zip top freezer bag for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the fridge before serving.

name: Easy Oatmeal Bars (with Blueberry and Carrot)
ingredients: ¾cup quick or instant oats (or rolled oats ground up in the food processor or blender)
½cup blueberries (cut in half if very large)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Preheat the oven and line a pan with parchment paper. Add the ingredients to a bowl.
3. Stir together gently, trying not to smash the berries.
4. Press into the prepared pan, pressing evenly to the edges.
5. Bake and remove from the oven. Let cool completely before slicing.
6. AD
7. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line an 8×8-inch pan with parchment paper so it overhangs on two sides so the bars are easy to lift out once baked and cooled.
8. Mix together all of the ingredients in a medium bowl except the blueberries. (Add the egg if using.) Stir in the blueberries gently.
9. Press into the prepared pan so the batter is even and pressed to the edges.
10. Bake for 24-26 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden brown and set.
11. Cool fully. (Really, please let it sit until it's cool to the touch! You can pop it into the fridge to speed this up if you'd like. It may crumble a bit if you slice when still warm.)
12. Slice into bars and serve or store. I typically cut into 16 small squares, but you can cut them larger if desired.
13. You can use honey instead of maple syrup.
14. I prefer the texture of carrots that are grated at home on a box grater as they are finer than those you can buy at the store.
15. Fresh blueberries work best in this recipe (frozen ones can cause the batter to seize up and be hard to press into the pan).
16. Cool fully before slicing to prevent the bars from crumbling when slicing.

name: Easy Pancake Muffins (Favorite Pancake Bites)
ingredients: 1cupmix-ins (such as blueberries, diced strawberries, diced bananas, chopped walnuts, or chocolate chips; if using chocolate chips, use 1/4-⅓ cup)
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and grease a mini muffin pan with nonstick spray.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Gently whisk in the eggs, vanilla, milk, and butter. Fold in the desired mix-in.
4. Divide batter among the prepared muffin pan.
5. Mini Muffins: Use 1 tablespoon batter in each muffin cup and bake for 12-14 minutes.
6. Standard Muffins: Use just under ¼ cup batter in each muffin and bake for 16-18 minutes. Check for doneness with a cake tester or toothpick. When inserted into the center, it should come out cleanly.
7. Serve with a dip such as applesauce, nut butter, yogurt, or maple syrup.

name: Easy Pear Popsicles
instructions:
1. Below is a look at the basic steps involved in making this popsicle recipe so you know what to expect from the process. Plan to start this 4-6 hours before you want to serve them so they have time to freeze.
2. AD
3. Pour the pears and juice into a bowl.
4. Roughly chop up with kitchen scissors or mash slightly with a potato masher.
5. Portion into popsicle molds.
6. Freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight. Release from the popsicle mold and serve.
7. How to Store
8. Transfer the frozen popsicles to a freezer bag, remove as much air as possible, and seal. Freeze for up to 6 months.
9. Best Tips for Success
10. Transfer the frozen popsicles to a freezer bag, remove as much air as possible, and seal. Freeze for up to 6 months.
11. Blend smooth in a blender if you prefer to have a completely smooth popsicle, though know that just chopping them yields a pretty smooth result, too.
12. To make this with fresh pears, freeze my Pear Puree and serve as a popsicle.

name: Easy Zucchini Pasta Sauce
ingredients: Parmesan cheese, lemon zest, and/or fresh black pepper (optional but recommended)
½cup white beans (such as cannellini beans)
2 tablespoons basil leaves (or parsley or spinach, optional)
Parmesan cheese, lemon zest, and/or fresh black pepper (optional but recommended)
instructions:
1. Below is an overview of the method for the recipe. Scroll down to the end of the post for the specifics. The main thing to know ahead of time is that you’ll want to reserve a little of the pasta cooking water before you drain the pasta. You’ll use that to help thin the zucchini sauce.
2. AD
3. Cook the pasta, reserving a little of the pasta cooking water. Meanwhile, Slice your zucchini and mince the garlic.
4. Sautee until cooked through and lightly golden brown.
5. Add to a blender with the remaining sauce ingredients, including a little bit of reserved cooking water.
6. Blend smooth.
7. How to Store
8. Store any remaining sauce in airtight containers in the fridge for up to 5 days. Or freeze in an ice cube tray overnight, transfer to a freezer bag, remove as much air as you can and freeze for up to 6 months.
9. Thaw 1-2 cubes overnight in the fridge in a container or at room temperature for about an hour and add to servings of pasta for easy meals.
10. Best Tips for Success
11. Trade in shallot or onion for the garlic if you like.
12. Use yellow summer squash if desired.
13. Add a few basil, spinach, or parsley leaves to enhance the green color.
14. Use any type of pasta you like, including regular, whole-wheat, or a bean-based pasta (which would be an easy way to add more iron to this meal).
15. If the kids don’t love sauce on their pasta, you can offer a small amount of the sauce with buttered pasta as shown above.
16. Reserve a little of the pasta cooking water to help thin the sauce as you blend it up.
17. Top with extra Parmesan, lemon, and black pepper as you like.
18. AD
19. Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Before draining, remove and reserve one cup of the pasta cooking water. Drain and set aside.
20. Meanwhile, cut the ends off of the zucchini and discard. Slice the zucchini about ¼-inch thick.
21. Add the olive oil to a medium skillet over medium heat. When warm, add the garlic. Toss to coat with the oil. Cook for 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
22. Add the zucchini and stir to coat with the oil. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, turning once or twice, or until the zucchini is very soft when poked with a fork. Remove from heat and let cool slightly for a few minutes.
23. Transfer the zucchini to a blender, adding the beans and optional herb or spinach. (That additional makes this a brighter green color.) Blend, starting slowly and working up to high. Add the pasta cooking water, ¼-cup at a time, to make a smooth sauce.
24. Add ½ of the sauce to the pasta and stir to combine. Add as much additional sauce as you like or store the remaining sauce for future use. Serve with Parmesan, lemon zest, and/or pepper as desired.

name: Enchilada Sauce
ingredients: 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar or distilled white vinegar
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions:
1. This sauce comes together quickly once you get started, so measure the dry ingredients (the flour, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt and optional cinnamon) into a small bowl and place it near the stove. Place the tomato paste and broth near the stove as well.
2. In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, warm the oil until it’s hot enough that a light sprinkle of the flour/spice mixture sizzles on contact. This might take a couple of minutes, so be patient and don’t step away from the stove!
3. Once it’s ready, pour in the flour and spice mixture. While whisking constantly, cook until fragrant and slightly deepened in color, about 1 minute. Whisk the tomato paste into the mixture, then slowly pour in the broth while whisking constantly to remove any lumps.
4. Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook, whisking often, for about 5 to 7 minutes, until the sauce has thickened a bit and a spoon encounters some resistance as you stir it. (The sauce will thicken some more as it cools.)
5. Remove from heat, then whisk in the vinegar and season to taste with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Add more salt, if necessary (I usually add another pinch or two). Go forth and make enchiladas!
6. STORAGE SUGGESTIONS: Extra enchilada sauce will keep well in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Or, freeze it for up to 3 months. Let it cool to room temperature before transferring to a wide-mouth mason jar, leaving some room at the top for expansion (don’t screw on the lid completely until the mixture is fully frozen), or a freezer bag (remove excess air before sealing).

name: Esquites (Mexican Street Corn Salad)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter or extra-virgin olive oil
1 tablespoon lime juice, plus extra lime wedges for garnish
1 teaspoon chili powder, plus more for sprinkling
Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat)
¼cup finely grated Cotija cheese**, plus more for sprinkling
instructions:
1. Melt the butter in a large skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium heat.
2. Once melted, add the corn and the salt (if using frozen corn, no need to defrost first). Cook, stirring just every minute or so, until the corn is warmed through and turning golden on the edges, about 5 to 8 minutes (turn the heat down to low if the corn starts jumping out of the pan).
3. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds, then remove the skillet from the heat.
4. Let the corn cool for a few minutes, then transfer it to a medium mixing bowl.
5. Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl (the mayonnaise, optional jalapeño, lime juice, chili powder, optional cayenne, cheese and cilantro). Stir to combine.
6. Season to taste with additional salt, if needed.
7. To serve, divide the mixture between small cups and garnish individual servings with a wedge of lime, perhaps a sprinkle of additional cheese and chili powder. Leftovers keep well, refrigerated, for about 4 days.

name: Favorite Bliss Balls
ingredients: 2 tablespoons shredded and unsweetened coconut (plus more for rolling, optional)
1cupfreeze-dried fruit (such as strawberries, blueberries, or raspberries)
instructions:
1. Below is an overview of how to make this recipe so you know what to expect. Scroll down to the end of this post for the full recipe, including the amounts and the timing.
2. Place the cashews in a medium bowl and cover with water. Let sit briefly to soften. Drain and pat dry with a paper towel.
3. Remove the pits from the dates, if needed. Add the cashews to the bowl of a food processor with the rest of the ingredients.
4. Pulse, stopping to scrape down the sides often, until ground into a relatively smooth paste-like dough.
5. Roll out balls of dough. Press into additional shredded coconut if desired. (If the batter becomes sticky, wash your hands and start again. You can serve these chilled or at room temperature.
6. Place the cashews in a medium bowl and cover with water. Let sit for 30 minutes to soften. Drain and pat dry with a paper towel.
7. Remove the pits from the dates, if needed.
8. Add the cashews to the bowl of a food processor with the rest of the ingredients. Pulse, stopping to scrape down the sides often, until ground into a relatively smooth paste-like dough.
9. Use a tablespoon measuring spoon to portion out dough, rolling each in the palm of your hand. Press into additional shredded coconut if desired. (If the batter becomes sticky, wash your hands and start again, or pop the batter into the fridge for a few minutes.)
10. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Favorite Mango Smoothie
ingredients: ½cup whole milk plain Greek yogurt (or regular yogurt)
½fresh large orange or 1 small orange (peeled; or ½ cup orange juice)
Optional veggies: ½ cup raw cauliflower florets or sliced summer squash
Optional seeds: 1 teaspoon hemp or ground flaxseed
Optional sweetener: 1 teaspoon honey or maple syrup
instructions:
1. AD
2. Gather the ingredients and any optional add-ins.
3. Blend, starting on low and working up to high.
4. Serve. You can also store it in the fridge and serve within 24 hours.
5. AD
6. Add all ingredients, including any add-ins, to a blender.
7. Blend until very smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
8. Serve or store in an airtight container or a reusable Squeasy Gear pouch, with the lid snapped, for up to 24 hours in the fridge.

name: Favorite Pizza Rolls (with Spinach and Cheese)
instructions:
1. Prep:Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2. Grease a muffin tin, making sure to coat the top edges of each cup (cheese may spill over).
3. Stretch the pizza dough into an 11x16-inch rectangle on a piece of parchment paper (this will prevent sticking). If the dough is too tough to stretch, let it rest for 5 minutes and try again.
4. Chop the spinach if it's not pre-chopped.
5. Cook:Spread the Toppings: Spread pizza sauce over the dough. Sprinkle on the spinach, mozzarella, and Parmesan evenly.
6. Roll the Dough: Starting on one long side, roll the dough up into a log, using the parchment paper to help you roll.
7. Slice: Cut the rolled dough into 12 even slices using a serrated knife. To make it easier, start cutting in the center, then work on cutting each half evenly.
8. Bake: Place each slice into the greased muffin tin. Bake for 22-26 minutes, or until the dough is baked through, the cheese is melted, and the tops are golden brown.
9. Cool: Let the rolls cool in the muffin tin for 3-5 minutes to let the cheese firm up. Use a knife to loosen any stuck cheese before transferring them to a wire rack or serving plate.
10. Storage:Fridge: Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.Freezer: Freeze in a zip-lock bag for up to 3 months. To reheat, microwave frozen rolls for 30-60 seconds or until warm.

name: Favorite Toddler Smoothie (with Veggies!)
ingredients: 1/2cupfresh or frozen fruit (such as blueberries, strawberries, mango, apple, or kiwi)

1/2cupveggies (such as kale, spinach, raw fresh or frozen chopped cauliflower, raw fresh or frozen sliced zucchini, raw fresh or frozen sliced summer squash, roasted sweet potato, roasted butternut squash, steamed diced beets)

Optional add ins (pick 1-2: 1 teaspoon hemp seeds, chia seeds, or ground flaxseed 1 tablespoon nut butter 2 tablespoons avocado 1-2 teaspoons cocoa powder 1-2 teaspoons honey or maple syrup 1 tablespoon rolled oats)
instructions:
1. Add the milk to the blender. (We prefer nondairy milks since they seem to have a slightly better consistency and less of a tendency to separate after blending.)
2. Add the fruit and veggie.
3. Add any optional ingredients.
4. Blend the smoothie really well to ensure that it has a very creamy texture.
5. Serve it in a reusable pouch, a small open cup, or in a sippy cup depending on what your kid likes best.
6. AD
7. Add chosen ingredients to a blender.
8. Blend until very smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl and adding more liquid if needed.
9. Serve immediately.

name: Favorite Yogurt Drinks
ingredients: 1cupfruit (such as fresh or frozen strawberries, banana, diced mango, blueberries, or pear)
1/4cupvegetable (optional, such as fresh spinach, Carrot Puree, Sweet Potato Puree)
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at how to make this kids drink. (I should add that I love it for myself, too!) Scroll down to the end of this post for the full information.
2. Choose your flavor and gather your ingredients.
3. Add all ingredients to a blender.
4. Blend well, starting on low speed and working up to high. If your blender came with a stick, use that to help move the mixture around as needed. If the mixture is having a hard time blending, add 2 tablespoons milk.
5. Serve or store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
6. AD
7. Add the ingredients to the blender.
8. Blend, starting on low and working up to high to blend very smooth.
9. (If your blender came with a stick, use it to help get the mixture moving if needed. If the mixture is ever challenging to blend, add 2 tablespoons milk.)
10. Sweeten to taste as desired using the honey or maple syrup.
11. Serve or store for a future meal.
12. Banana-Cauliflower: Use 1 cup sliced very ripe banana and ¼ cup raw fresh or frozen cauliflower.
13. Use whole milk Greek yogurt for the creamiest texture. Regular yogurt will work, though it will be a little less creamy.
14. Blend the ingredients, taste, then sweeten with honey (for kids over age 1) or maple syrup to taste. Sweetness can vary considerably in fruit.
15. Use fresh or frozen fruit. If you use frozen fruit and the mixture is a little difficult to blend, add 2 tablespoons milk.
16. Add 1 tablespoon hemp seeds for additional healthy fats and protein, if desired.
17. Dairy-free: Use nondairy yogurt or kefir. This also works with lactose-free options.
18. Serve in a reusable pouch, a Smoothie Cup, or a small open cup as you like.

name: Favorite Yogurt Melts
instructions:
1. Choose your yogurt.
2. Add to a plastic bag and pipe out.
3. Freeze.
4. Serve or transfer to a storage bag.
5. AD
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
7. Add the yogurt to a zip top bag and seal. Cut off one bottom corner and gently squeeze out little dots of yogurt in rows on the prepared tray. (I make them about the size of a dime, though you can go smaller to the size of a pencil eraser.)
8. Place tray into the freezer and freeze for at least 2 hours and up to overnight.
9. To serve, remove from the freezer and let sit at room temperature for 3-5 minutes before serving to ensure they aren’t frozen solid. (You can try one to make sure it melts easily on your tongue!) Babies and toddlers should be able to pick them up with their hands.

name: Favorite Yogurt Muffins
ingredients: ¼cup unsalted butter (melted and slightly cooled)
1cupshredded carrots, ½ cup raisins, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
2cupsfinely diced strawberries (add 1 tablespoon fresh lemon zest if desired)
instructions:
1. With a base recipe that bakes up perfectly fluffy and just-sweet-enough muffins, and 6 options to add flavors from fruit, veggies, spices, and chocolate chips, this Yogurt Muffin recipe is as versatile as it is delicious!
2. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 12-cup standard muffin pan with nonstick spray.
3. In a medium bowl, stir together the flours, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
4. In another bowl, stir together the yogurt, maple syrup, butter, eggs, and vanilla.
5. Gently stir the yogurt mixture into the flour mixture. (Expect the batter to be thick.)
6. Add your desired add-in. (You can also add 1 tablespoon of any add-in to each muffin cup, using ¼ cup batter, to make a batch with a few different flavors. Or you can bake them plain.) Stir gently to combine.
7. Divide batter among the prepared muffin tin, using about ¼ cup batter in each cup.
8. Bake for 16-18 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden brown and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven, then transfer muffins to a wire rack to cool fully.
9. Top with butter, nut butter, or jam as desired.

name: Freezer Ready Mini Pizzas
instructions:
1. Line two small baking sheets with foil or parchment paper (or do one sheet at a time, preparing the second batch the second day).
2. Open the bagels and line them up on the baking sheets with cut sides facing up.
3. Spread about 1 Tbsp pizza sauce over the surface of each muffin, then top with about 2 Tbsp shredded mozzarella.
4. Chop the salad bar vegetables into very small pieces, then divide them evenly among the pizzas. Press down lightly on top of each pizza to help compact the toppings and keep them in place as they freeze. Cover the baking sheets with plastic wrap and freeze for about 8 hours, or until the pizzas are solid.
5. Once the pizzas are frozen solid, carefully transfer them to a gallon sized freezer bag for long term storage (you may need two bags). For the best results, the pizzas should be cooked and eaten within 3 months.
6. To bake the pizzas, take out the number you wish to bake, place them on a baking sheet, and let them partially thaw as you preheat the oven to 400ºF (about 7 minutes). Once the oven is fully preheated, bake the pizzas for about 15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Baking time will vary depending on your oven and the amount of toppings on the pizzas.

name: Frozen Yogurt Bark
ingredients: 1cupregular or Greek-style plain yogurt (whole-milk yogurt preferred)
½cup full-fat coconut milk (the solids from one 14.5-ounce can)
2 tablespoons maple syrup (or honey, optional to taste)
cereal, sprinkles, additional fruit (for topping, optional)
instructions:
1. To make the blended option, add the berries, yogurt, maple syrup and coconut milk to a blender.
2. Blend until smooth.
3. Line a half sheet pan with parchment paper. (This makes the bark easier to break once it’s frozen since it won’t freeze to the pan.) Pour the blended yogurt mixture overtop. Smooth to about ¼-½ inch thick. Add optional toppings if using.
4. Freeze for at least 4 hours. To serve, break into pieces and eat immediately.
5. (To make without a blender, stir together the yogurt and coconut milk, spread on the prepared pan, then top with optional toppings and freeze.)
6. Add the berries, yogurt, syrup and coconut milk to a blender. Blend smooth.
7. Line a half sheet pan with parchment paper. Pour the blended yogurt mixture overtop. Smooth to about ¼-½ inch thick. Add optional toppings if using.
8. Freeze for at least 4 hours.
9. To serve, break into pieces and eat immediately.

name: Fruit and Nut Bars (Copycat Larabar)
ingredients: 1½cup cashews or almonds (raw or roasted and unsalted)
½cup pitted dates (Medjool or Deglet Noir)
½cup dried cherries (or dried apples, apricots, raisins, or prunes)
instructions:
1. Below is an overview of this recipe so you know what to expect. Scroll to the end of the post for the details on amounts and timing.
2. Place the cashews into a medium bowl and cover with hot water. Let sit to soften. Drain. (This helps the nuts soften enough to grind into the batter.)
3. Add the drained nuts to a food processor with the rest of the ingredients.
4. Grind into a batter, starting on low and working up to high. (You will likely need to let the machine run for about a minute until the batter starts to hold together like cookie dough.) Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl if needed to help the mixture move thoroughly.
5. Press into a silicone mold (I use a 1 cup Souper Cube) or an 8×8-inch baking pan lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate briefly, then slice into bars.
6. Place the cashews into a medium bowl and cover with hot water. Let sit for at least 10 and up to 30 minutes. Drain. (This helps the nuts soften enough to grind into the batter.)
7. Add the drained nuts to a food processor with the rest of the ingredients. Grind into a batter, starting on low and working up to high. (You will likely need to let the machine run for about a minute until the batter starts to hold together like cookie dough.) Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl if needed to help the mixture move thoroughly.
8. Press into a silicone mold (I use a 1-cup Souper Cube) or an 8×8-inch baking pan. Refrigerate for about 10 minutes, then slice into bars.
9. Wrap in plastic wrap and store in a bag or store unwrapped bars in an airtight container.

name: Garlic Parmesan White Beans
ingredients: ¼ to ⅓cup shaved Parmesan cheese
instructions:
1. In a large pan, warm 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook briefly, tossing regularly, until just golden.
2. Add the cannellini beans and ½ cup water. Season with kosher salt, black pepper, and the spices. Add the tomatoes. Cook, stirring occasionally until warmed through (about 10 minutes)
3. Stir in the parsley, cheese, and lemon juice.
4. AD
5. Finish with a generous drizzle of extra virgin olive oil. Serve immediately with pita or your favorite crusty bread.

name: Ginger Chutney Allam Chutney
instructions:
1. In a pan/ kadai, add 1 tablespoon urad dal, 6 red chilli and roast in medium flame until slightly golden.
2. Now add ginger, tamarind and roast well for 2 minutes or until dal turns deep golden.
3. Remove in a plate for cooling. Transfer the ingredients to a mixer along with salt and jaggery.
4. Add ¼ cup water and grind smoothly or it can also be slightly coarse.
5. Heat a pan/ kadai, with a teaspoon of oil. Splutter ¼ teaspoon mustard, add curry leaves.
6. Transfer to chutney bowl and mix well.

name: Granny Eggs
ingredients: French, country or whole wheat bread
1 egg for each slice of bread
instructions:
1. Cut a circle in each slice of bread, so it has a large hole in it.
2. Over medium heat, heat greased skillet.
3. Put bread on the skillet and crack an egg into the hole. Break yolk, if desired.
4. Once the egg is mostly cooked, flip bread and cook through.
5. Serve with the circle as a piece of plain bread or toast.

name: Greek Quesadillas
instructions:
1. Thinly slice the spinach, red onion and olives. Chop the fresh oregano (if using).
2. For each quesadilla, place a tortilla on a plate and evenly spread with ¼ of the spinach, red onion, olives, mozzarella cheese, feta cheese, and oregano. Sprinkle with a few red pepper flakes (if using).
3. Heat a large non-stick skillet* over medium heat for a few minutes. Place the loaded tortilla on the griddle and place another tortilla on top. Cook until browned on the bottom, then flip and cook until browned on the other side, a few minutes per side.
4. Remove the tortilla and cut into wedges with a pizza cutter. If making several quesadillas at once, keep them warm in a 300°F oven.

name: Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup
instructions:
1. Spread a thin layer of butter on one side of each slice of bread.
2. (Optional) Sprinkle a pinch of garlic powde inside the sandwich for added flavor.
3. Place one slice of bread, buttered side down, on the preheated pan.
4. Add the cheese slices on top, along with a slice of tomato if desired, then cover with the second slice of bread, buttered side up.
5. Cook on medium heat for about 2-3 minutes on one side, pressing gently with a spatula, until golden brown.
6. Flip carefully and cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes until the bread is crispy and the cheese is fully melted.
7. Pour the Trader Joe's tomato soup into a small pot or microwave-safe bowl.
8. Heat on the stovetop for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or microwave for 2-3 minutes.
9. For a creamier soup, stir in a splash of milk or cream while heating.
10. Cut the grilled cheese in half (diagonally for a classic touch!).
11. Pour the hot tomato soup into a bowl.
12. Pair your sandwich with the soup and enjoy dipping for extra flavor.

name: Guacamole
instructions:
1. Cut the avocados, score and mash in the bowl.
2. Sprinkle with salt and lime (or lemon) juice.
3. Add the chopped onion, cilantro, black pepper.
4. If making a few hours ahead, place plastic wrap on the surface of the guacamole and press down to cover it to prevent air reaching it. (The oxygen in the air causes oxidation which will turn the guacamole brown.)
5. Refrigerate leftover guacamole up to 3 days.

name: Healthy Breakfast Bars with Jam
instructions:
1. Line the pan with parchment paper.
2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line an 8×8-inch baking sheet. Leave a few inches overhang on two sides so you can easily lift the bars out when they’re cooled.
3. Place the oats into the bowl of a food processor or blender and blitz to grind into a coarse flour.
4. Place the honey and peanut butter into a medium bowl and warm in the microwave for about 15 seconds.
5. Add the oats and the remaining ingredients except the jam to the bowl with the peanut butter and honey and stir together.
6. Use clean hands to bring the dough together as needed to form a thick, cookie dough-like texture. It will hold together when pressed between your fingers.
7. Set aside ¾ cup of the batter.
8. Place the remaining batter into the bottom of the prepared baking pan and press down evenly to cover.
9. Spread the jam on top.
10. Crumble the remaining dough over the jam and press down slightly.
11. Bake for 22-24 minutes, remove from oven, and let cool completely in the pan. (You can speed this up by sticking the pan into the fridge.
12. Lift the bars out using the parchment paper and slice into bars.

name: Healthy Homemade Fruit Roll Ups (+ Flavor Guide)
instructions:
1. Blend: Blend together all ingredients in food processor or blender until smooth. Taste and adjust sweetness as needed.
2. Spread: Pour into a pan lined with parchment paper then spread out ⅛ to ¼ inch thick.
3. Dehydrate: Dehydrate in oven at 140 to 170°F (or as low as oven will go) for 4 to 6 hours, or until the middle is not longer tacky.
4. Cool: Allow to cool, then use clean scissors to trim off edges and cut into 1 inch wide strips. Roll each strip into a roll-up and enjoy!

name: Healthy Vegetable Sheet Pan Frittata
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees and put a quarter sheet pan (9x13 inches) in the oven.
2. In a large saute pan heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and saute a few minutes until starting to turn tender. Add the tomato and cook another couple of minutes until they start to break. Add the spinach and cook just until it starts to wilt. Generously sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
3. While that's cooking whisk together the eggs, milk, ricotta and italliann seasoning. Then salt and pepper the mixture. I used ½ teaspon of each.
4. Remove the sheet pan from the oven and spray with cooking spray. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and carefully spoon the veggie mixture on top. Sprinkle with the feta cheese.
5. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the eggs are cooked.

name: HIGH PROTEIN ‘MARRY ME’ BREAKFAST TOAST
ingredients: 1tbspfresh oregano chopped or 1 tsp dried oregano
1.50 cups cooked or canned butter beans
Salt and pepper to taste (I didn’t add salt as my sun-dried tomatoes were salty!)
500gcottage cheese (can use vegan cottage cheese alternative)
instructions:
1. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil, asafoetida, Italian seasoning, chilli flakes and paprika. Sauté for 1 minute. Then add sun-dried tomatoes, oregano and olives. Sauté for 2 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar and tomato paste and cook for additional 2 minutes.
2. Add coconut milk and nutritional yeast and mix until well combined. Pour in butter beans and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Taste and adjust the salt as desired.
3. In a food processor combine cottage cheese and feta until completely smooth. If desired without feta, simply whip the cottage cheese until a smooth consistency.
4. To assemble: On a slice of toast, spread desired amount of whipped cottage cheese, layer butter beans on top, sprinkle with parsley and optional chilli crisp. Enjoy!

name: Homemade Frozen Yogurt
ingredients: 1cupfrozen berries (such as raspberries, strawberries, cherries, or blueberries, mango, pineapple, or banana slices)
instructions:
1. Add frozen fruit and yogurt to the blender.
2. Blend, starting slowly, then gradually increasing. (I have a Vitamix blender) and use the stick that came with it to help things keep moving since the mixture is thick.)
3. Keep blending until smooth and uniform in texture. (If your blender doesn’t have a stick to help move ingredients and the mixture is getting stuck, you can add a tablespoon or two of milk or orange juice to help things move.)
4. You can also use a food processor if that’s what you have.
5. Combine the ingredients in a high-powered blender.
6. Blend until very smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed (and using the stick attachment if one came with your blender).
7. Serve immediately.
8. You can use plain yogurt, too. If using plain, sweeten to taste with maple syrup or honey as needed. (It will depend on which fruit you use and how sweet it is.)
9. To store leftovers, place into a freezer-safe container and freeze for up to a month. Let sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes to soften before serving. You can also freeze into popsicle molds.

name: Homemade Larabars
ingredients: 1-½cups dates or a combination of dates and another variety of dried fruit
instructions:
1. Place dates into a small heat-safe bowl. Pour hot water over the dates and allow to soak for 10-15 minutes to soften the dates.
2. Once the dates have soaked, drain the liquid off the dates, reserving the liquid to use if needed.
3. Fit a food processor with an s-blade. Place nuts in the food processor and pulse until the nuts break down into small pieces.
4. Add in the dates and dash of salt, and pulse the mixture together until the dates have broken down and a thick paste forms, scraping the sides down if needed. Add in 1 to 2 tablespoons of the soaking liquid if needed to help bring the mixture together.
5. To shape larabars press mixture into a 7×11 pan lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for 30 minutes before slicing int0 6 bars.
6. Alternatively, you can shape the mixture into 1-2 inch balls for a bite-size treat.

name: Homemade Oatmeal Cream Pies
ingredients: 1 tablespoon milk or half and half
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.
