2. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or in a large bowl with an electric mixer, cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add in eggs and vanilla and mix until combined.
3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Slowly add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Add in oats and mix until incorporated.
4. To make large cookies, use a large cookie scoop (about 3 tablespoons) to drop dough onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 13-15 minutes or until golden brown. Allow cookies to sit on cookie sheets for about 5 minutes before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely. To makes small cookies, use a medium cookie scoop (about 1.5 tablespoons) of dough per cookie and bake for 10-12 minutes. Once cookies have cooled completely, prepare the cream filling.
5. Prepare the Cream Filling:
6. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat butter on medium-high speed for about 5 minutes. This process will lighten the color of the butter and ensure you buttercream in extra fluffy.
7. Turn the speed down to low and gradually add in the powdered sugar. Continue mixing on low speed until the powdered sugar is completely incorporated. Add in vanilla extract and milk and mix until combined.
8. Turn mixer back up to medium-high speed and beat the mixture for an additional 3-5 minutes. If needed, add in a little more cream 1 teaspoon at a time until you reach the consistency you desire.
9. To assemble the cookies, pipe or spread the cream filling on the flat side of half of the cookies and put the remaining cookies on top.

name: Hotel Sambar
instructions:
1. **Prep:**Cook 1/2 cup of toor dal.
2. Chop carrot, potato, tomato, onion.
3. Soak tamarind: Take a small lemon-sized piece of tamarind and soak it in ¼ cup warm water for about 10 minutes. Then squeeze and strain to get the juice.
4. Cook:Take the chopped carrot, potato, and onion with 1 cup water.Boil until vegetables are soft and cooked through.
5. Add the chopped tomato to the cooked vegetables and cook for 2 minutes.
6. Add the mashed dal to the pot.
7. Stir in 1½ tablespoons sambar powder.
8. Add the tamarind extract and salt to taste.
9. Let everything simmer together for about 5 minutes.
10. Make the tempering (tadka):
11. In a small pan, heat 2 teaspoons oil.
12. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds and let them pop.
13. Add a pinch of asafoetida and 1 dried red chili, broken in half.
14. Let it sizzle for a few seconds, then turn off the heat.
15. Pour the tempering into the simmering sambar.
16. Mix well and let it simmer 2 more minutes.
17. Add cilantro for garnish.

name: How to Make Coconut Rice
ingredients: 1 tablespoon maple syrup, ½ teaspoon cinnamon, and/or ½ teaspoon turmeric (optional)
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at making this coconut rice so you know what to expect from the process. Scroll down to see the full recipe at the bottom of the post.
2. AD
3. Place the rice into a medium bowl and fill with water. Swirl and pour off the cloudy liquid. Repeat a few more times until the water is mostly clear.
4. Add the coconut oil to a medium pot placed over medium heat. Grate the ginger, if using, with a fine microplane into the warm oil. Stir and cook for about a minute. Stir in the rice to coat.
5. Add water and bring to a simmer. Cook until the water is almost all absorbed.
6. Stir in the coconut milk. Cook until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is soft. Remove from heat and cover. Let sit and stir in the shredded coconut, if using. (I recommend you use it!) Serve warm.
7. AD
8. Place the rice into a medium bowl and fill with water. Swirl and pour off the cloudy liquid. Repeat a few more times until the water is mostly clear.
9. Add the coconut oil to a medium pot placed over medium heat. Grate the ginger, if using, with a fine microplane into the warm oil. Stir and cook for about a minute. Stir in the rice to coat.
10. Add 4 cups water and bring to a simmer. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the water is almost all absorbed, stirring once or twice. Stir in the coconut milk and bring back to a simmer. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is soft, stirring a few times.
11. Remove from heat and cover. Let sit for at least 5 minutes. Stir in the shredded coconut, maple syrup, cinnamon, and/or turmeric if using. Serve warm.

name: Idli Dosa Batter
instructions:
1. Rinse the Urad Dal and methi in water for 2-3 times.
2. Rinse the rice separately 2-3 times.
3. Soak the Urad dal and methi in one bowl, and Rice in another bowl for minimum 4 hours but ideally overnight.
4. Preheat oven to 200F.
5. Grind the Urad dal with minimum water to fine and fluffy consistency.
6. Grind the rice with minimum water.
7. Add 1/4 tablespoon of salt and mix everything with hand for at least 2-3 minutes.
8. Add 1/4 to 1/2 tsp. of baking soda (or baking powder) while you mix the batter if it's a very cold day.
9. Turn off oven and place batter for 10-24 hours.

name: Instant Nei Appam
instructions:
1. In a blender, place banana, jaggery or brown sugar, cardamom, salt and grind smoothly.
2. Add rice flour and wheat flour to it along and blend again.
3. No need to add water. If needed only add later maximum 1 or 2 tbsp. Batter should be like pancake batter or idli dosa batter consistency.
4. Transfer to the bowl. Heat appe pan/ paniyaram pan and generously drizzle with ghee.
5. Pour the batter in the shallows (kuzhi) and cook covered in medium flame.
6. Flip and cook again to cook until golden on both sides. Add ghee more on top if desired.

name: Instant Pot Lasagna Soup
instructions:
1. Dice the onion, bell pepper and spinach.
2. Set your IP to saute mode and add two tablespoons of oil. Once the oil is hot, add the serrano chilis, oregano and garlic and let splutter for a few moments.
3. Add the onions and peppers and continue to cook for 5 minutes.
4. Prepare the broth (4 cups) + 1 extra cup of water.
5. Once the onions and peppers have softened, add in the rao's sauce, spinach, vegetable broth, 1 cup water, scallions, cilantro, and parsley.
6. Stir well for a few minutes until all the ingredients are incorporated.
7. Add in the pasta (4-5 cups)
8. Hit cancel on the IP and switch it to Pressure Cook on High Mode. Cut the cooking time on the box in half for the pressure cook time (box said 6 minutes to al dente- so I cooked the pasta for 3 minutes).
9. After it cooks, immediately do a quick release.
10. The consistency should be soupy.
11. If it is too thick- add water in one cup increments until you reach the desired consistency.
12. If your pasta is undercooked- just set it on saute mode and let it simmer until the pasta cooks.
13. Add in the mozzarella. No additional salt needed.

name: Instant Pot Mexican Rice & Beans
ingredients: 2 scallions, finely chopped with whites and green parts separated
instructions:
1. Turn the Instant Pot on saute mode and add 2 tbsp of oil. Once the oil is hot, add the green chilis and white parts of the scallions. Let them splutter for about 30 seconds or so and then add the diced onions.
2. Saute the onions for about 2-3 minutes until they are slightly soft. Hit cancel to turn the IP off and then immediately add the rinsed rice, salt, garlic, taco seasoning, chili powder, and cumin powder. Stir for about 2 minutes until garlic is fragrant but not browned.
3. Add the broth, and use a spatula to scrape up and browned bits of spices stuck to the pot (be sure to do this well so you don't get a BURN notice on your IP. Once you've added the broth, stir well.
4. Next, add the salsa into the IP but do not mix it it in, just place it in the center right over the rice and do not touch it.
5. Place your lid on the IP and set the IP to High Pressure Cook Mode and set the timer for 4 minutes. Once the IP beeps (and the pressure cooking phase is complete) quick release after 10 minutes.
6. Open the IP and use a fork to fluff and mix the rice very gently. Mixing the rice too vigourously at this stage will break the rice up and make it mushy. Let the rice sit for about 5 minutes. Next add in the pinto beans, corn and remaining green parts of the scallions. Taste for salt and adjust as needed.
7. Serve as a side, topped with shredded lettuce, pico de gallo and a dollop of sour cream.

name: IP Dal Tadka
instructions:
1. Start the instant pot in sauté mode and heat the oil in it. Add cumin seeds, green chili, curry leaves, garlic and asafoetida.
2. After the garlic turns light brown, add the chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes until the onions turn golden brown.
3. Add tomato and spices and cook for another 2 minutes.
4. Add the washed dal and water. Stir it all up.
5. Close the lid with vent in sealing position.
6. Change the instant pot setting to manual or pressure cook mode at high pressure for for 5 mins. After the instant pot beeps, let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes, then release the pressure manually (5 minute NPR).
7. Using tongs, carefully take out the bowl of basmati rice. Then take out the trivet.
8. Garnish with cilantro and stir. Optionally, sprinkle the juice of half a lemon. Dal tadka is ready to be served.

name: IP Masoor Dal / Red Lentils
instructions:
1. Start the pressure cooker in sauté mode and let it heat. Add oil and cumin seeds. Sauté for 30 seconds.
2. When the cumin seeds change color, add green chili, onions, ginger and garlic. Sauté for 3 minutes until the onions become golden brown while stirring frequently.
3. Add tomato and spices. Stir and sauté for another 2 minutes.
4. For regular dal, use 3 cups of water. Reduce to 2.5 for thicker dal. Add the lentils, water and stir well.
5. (For pot-in-pot rice) Place the trivet. In a bowl, add all ingredients for basmati rice and place it on top of the trivet. Close the lid with vent in sealing position.
6. Press cancel and close lid with vent in sealing position. Change the instant pot setting to manual or pressure cook mode at high pressure for 5 mins.
7. After the instant pot beeps, let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes, then release the pressure manually (5 minute NPR).
8. Open the pot. Add the lime juice and stir the dal.
9. Garnish with cilantro. Serve dal with roti, naan or rice.
10. For stovetop pressure cooker, cook for 1 whistles (about 5 minutes) and let the pressure release naturally.

name: IP No Soak Kidney Beans / Rajma
instructions:
1. Add kidney beans and water to the Instant Pot and stir to prevent sticking.
2. Pressure cook on high (40 minutes for more firm, 45 for more tender)
3. It take about 8 minutes for the Instant Pot to pressurize before cooking begins.
4. Allow to naturally release for 15 minutes, then release any remaining pressure.
5. Carefully remove lid once steam has fully escaped and strain off any excess cooking liquid.
6. Store cooled leftovers in the refrigerator up to 5 days or in the freezer up to 1 month.
7. Reheat in a saucepan on the stovetop, adding a little water, as needed, to prevent sticking.

name: IP Quinoa Chili
instructions:
1. Prep:Dice 1 cup yellow onion.Dice 1 cup green bell pepper.Finely dice ½ a jalapeño.Mince 3 cloves garlic.Wash ⅓ cup quinoa.Rinse and drain 1 can black beans (about 1.25 cups).
2. Cook
3. Add all the ingredients to the Instant Pot in this order:Diced onion, bell pepper, jalapeño, and garlic.
4. Washed quinoa, 1 can fire-roasted diced tomatoes (14.5 oz), 1 cup frozen corn, and the rinsed black beans.
5. Add ¾ tablespoon chili powder, ½ tablespoon paprika, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, and 1 teaspoon salt (adjust later to taste).
6. Pour in 2 cups vegetable broth.
7. Pressure Cook: Close the lid and set the vent to sealing. Cook on high pressure for 6 minutes.
8. Release Pressure: Once done, allow the pressure to release naturally (this might take 10-15 minutes). Open the lid and taste the chili. Adjust the salt if necessary.
9. Serve: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Add any optional toppings you like:
10. Shredded cheddarAvocado, lemon wedges, or diced red onionSour cream or greek yogurtServe with tortilla chips
11. Refrigerate: Store in an airtight container for up to 4 days.Freeze: Portion into small containers and freeze. Reheat in the microwave or on the stove when ready to eat.

name: IP Ven Pongal
instructions:
1. (optional) Switch on the saute mode on your Instant pot and add the moong dal to it. Roast it until nice and fragrant for a couple of minutes. Remove it.
2. Add the moong dal, rice to a bowl or strainer and wash them well.
3. Start instant pot in sauté mode and heat ghee in it. Add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, asafoetida, curry leaves, and cashews.
4. Saute till the cashews are lightly roasted. Take out half of the tempering and reserve for later. Add green chili and ginger.
5. When the ginger turns golden brown, add rice and moong dal. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add water and salt. Close lid with vent in sealing position.
7. Change the instant pot setting to rice mode, which defaults to low pressure cooking for 12 minutes.
8. When the instant pot beeps, let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, then manually release the remaining pressure (10 minute NPR).
9. Open the instant pot, and serve pongal. Top with reserved tempering with roasted cashews. Enjoy hot with sambar and chutney!

name: Jeera Rice
instructions:
1. using cooked basmati rice:
2. now in a large heat 1 tsp ghee and splutter 1 tsp cumin seeds.
3. now add in cooked basmati rice, ¼ tsp salt and mix gently.
4. finally, add 2 tbsp coriander leaves and enjoy jeera rice with dal.
5. using pressure cooker:
6. firstly, in a cooker heat 1 tsp ghee and splutter 1 tsp cumin seeds.
7. now add ½ cup basmati rice (soaked 20 minutes) and saute for a minute.
8. add 1 cup of water, ¼ tsp salt and mix well.
9. cover and pressure cook for 2 whistles.
10. finally, add 2 tbsp coriander leaves and enjoy jeera rice with dal.

name: Khaman Dhokla IP
instructions:
1. Prepare Khaman Batter:
2. Mix in all of the ingredients, except the Eno fruit salt – gram flour, semolina, turmeric, salt, sugar, green chili, ginger, lime juice, oil and water. Stir to combine well and let the batter sit for 15 minutes.
3. While the batter is resting, boil 2 cups water in the pressure cooker on sauté mode. Also, grease the steel pan in which you will make the khaman with oil. I used one container from the stackable steel containers for the instant pot.
4. After 15 minutes, add Eno to the batter and stir it gently in one direction. The batter will become frothy and increase in volume. Do not over stir.
5. Quickly transfer the batter to the greased steel container and place the container on a trivet. It is important to start cooking quickly after adding Eno to get soft and fluffy Khaman.
6. Steaming in Instant Pot
7. Then place the trivet along with the pan in the instant pot. Set to Steam mode for 15 mins in venting mode. The instant pot timer does not work in venting mode, hence you will need to set an external timer.
8. After the cooking time is done, let the khaman sit for 5 minutes. Then open the lid of the instant pot and take out the khaman using tongs.
9. Let it cool for 5 more minutes, so it is easy to remove. Insert a knife or toothpick to check it is cooked. The knife should come out almost clean. If not, you will need to steam for 2-3 more minutes.
10. Run a knife around the edges of the khaman. Place a plate on top of the container and turn it upside down. This will help to get the khaman out of the container easily.
11. Prepare Tempering
12. While the khaman is steaming in the instant pot, heart oil in a pan on stovetop on high heat.
13. Then add the mustard seeds and let them sizzle. Now add the curry leaves. Let them sauté for about 30 seconds. Add the sesame seeds and turn off heat.
14. Now add water, sugar, salt and stir well.
15. Cut the khaman into small pieces. Spread the tempering over it.
16. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with green mint chutney.

name: Kondakadalai Kala Channa Masala Sundal
instructions:
1. To start with, wash and soak chana overnight.
2. Next day, drain water and add just enough water to immerse the chana completely.
3. Then, add salt and asafoetida and pressure cook for 5 whistles.
4. Roast and grind:Chana dal, coriander seeds, pepper, red chili, little oil
5. Add cumin and asafoetida lastly as it will burn.
6. Roast until chana dal turns golden in colour and aroma wafts. Cool down and powder.
7. Temper:Oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves
8. Drain the cooked chana and add to the temper pot. Add the powdered masala and grated coconut.
9. Mix well for 2 minutes in medium flame.
10. Quick option: You can make this same without the powder too. Just temper with 2 red chillies.

name: Lemon Crinkle Cookies
ingredients: ¾cup room temperature unsalted butter (or vegan butter)
2 vegan egg (I used Bob's Red Mill egg replacer)
½cup mini vegan white chocolate chips
Optional yellow food dye (I used 3 drops of organic yellow dye)
instructions:
1. In a medium bowl, sift the flour, baking powder, cornstarch, and salt. Set aside.
2. Zest the lemon into a small bowl. And press the lemon juice into a separate bowl.
3. Using a mixer, beat the butter and sugar on high speed for 3-4 minutes. It should be soft and pale. Scrape the bowl using a rubber spatula.
4. Add in the lemon zest, lemon juice, vanilla and egg replacer. Mix on medium until combined. Add in the yellow gel food dye if desired. I added 3 drops.
5. Add in the dry ingredients. Mix on low speed until just combined. Add in the white chocolate chips and mix on low.
6. Cover dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 2 days. Chilling is required for this sticky cookie dough.
7. Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator.
8. Preheat the oven to 350℉. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. Let the cookie dough rest for 10 minutes. This helps to prevent too much spread.
9. Place the sugar in one bowl and the powdered sugar in another bowl. Use a small cookie scoop (1 oz or 1 Tablespoon) and scoop the dough. Place 12 cookie dough balls per cookie sheet.
10. Roll the cookie dough ball in the sugar first. Then, roll in the powdered sugar. Make sure it has a thick coat of powdered sugar.
11. Once all rolled, bake for 11-13 minutes. Bake until the edges are set. Make sure to not over bake these, otherwise they will be dry and the powdered sugar will melt.
12. Cool the cookies on the hot pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

name: Loaded Greek Chickpea Pasta Salad
instructions:
1. Prep
2. Dice bell peppers and cucumber.
3. Halve cherry tomatoes.
4. Chop kalamata olives
5. CookPrepare all vegetables and place them in a large bowl with the feta, chickpeas and parsley.
6. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and add to the bowl.
7. Add all dressing ingredients to a small bowl and whisk until combined.  This includes olive oil, wine vinegar, garlic, dijon mustard, maple syrup, oregano, salt and pepper.
8. Pour dressing over pasta salad and mix all ingredients together until it’s combined.
9. Pasta salad can be served immediately or refrigerated up to 3 days.
10. If turning into Mason jar salad, layer asdressing, pasta, veggies, chickpeas, feta.

name: Mango Yogurt
instructions:
1. If making with fresh mango: Add fruit to a blender and blend smooth.
2. If making with frozen mango: Thaw at room temperature or warm for about 1 minute in the microwave. Add them to the blender and blend smooth.
3. If making with mango puree, add directly.
4. Stir together with the yogurt to make a uniform mixture.
5. Add any optional ingredients (lime juice, lime zest)
6. Stir and serve with granola.

name: Masoor Dal
instructions:
1. Add masoor dal & moong dal to a pot or pressure cooker. Wash it a few times until the water runs clear.
2. Next add chopped tomatoes, water and green chili.
3. Pressure cook for 1 to 2 whistles on a medium heat. If cooking in a pot, bring the water to a rolling boil, reduce the heat and cook until soft, adding more hot water if needed. Skim off any froth that rises to the top.
4. Once the pressure drops, open the cooker.
5. Mash the dal to suit your liking. You can make it smooth or keep it coarse for a texture. If needed you can pour 2 to 3 tbsp hot water to bring it to a consistency.
6. **Temper/ Tadka**Heat ghee (or oil or butter) in a small pan, on a medium heat.
7. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies and chopped garlic.
8. Saute until the garlic turns slightly golden. Turn off the heat and add hing, chili powder, turmeric & garam masala.
9. Quickly pour this off to the dal. (If you want you may set aside half of the tempering along with red chili to garnish later.)
10. Time to add salt and crushed kasuri methi if using. Mix and simmer for 2 mins. Taste test and add more salt if required.
11. Squeeze in some lemon & garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving. Masoor dal is ready to serve with roti or rice.
12. **Instant Pot Masoor Dal**Press saute button on the Instant pot and pour oil to the inner pot.
13. Add mustard, cumin, broken red chilies and garlic.
14. When they splutter add tomatoes along with salt, chilli powder, hing, garam masala (optional) and turmeric.
15. Saute for 1 min. Next add dal, green chilli and 2 cups water.
16. Stir well and deglaze to release any bits of food stuck. Secure the Instant pot with lid. Set the steam release handle to sealing.
17. Optional :You can cook basmati rice together by placing the rice bowl on a long legged trivet.
18. Press pressure cook button and set the timer for 7 mins.
19. Wait for the pressure to release naturally. When the pin drops, open the IP.
20. Add kasuri methi and stir well. Taste test and add more salt or garam masala if required. If the dal is runny, cook on saute mode for a few minutes. If it is too thick pour little hot water and saute for a minute.
21. Squeeze lemon juice and garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve masoor dal with rice.

name: Mattar Paneer Sabji
instructions:
1. **Prep:**Roughly chop onion and tomatoes.Cube paneerCook the frozen peas in the microwave.
2. CookHeat oil, ginger, garlic. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add 4 tomatoes, 2 tbsp cashew, and saute until the tomato turn soft and mushy.
4. Cool completely, and transfer to a mixer jar.
5. Grind to smooth paste without adding water.
6. In the pan, heat 2 tbsp oil. add 1 tsp ghee, 1 tsp cumin, and 2 chilli. Saute until the spices turn aromatic.
7. Keeping the flame on low, add ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chilli powder, ½ tsp coriander powder, ½ tsp cumin powder, and ½ tsp garam masala.
8. Saute until the spices turn aromatic.
9. Add prepared gravy and cook until the oil separates from the gravy base.
10. Add 3 cup water and 1 tsp salt.
11. Add 1½ cups peas and paneer cubes.
12. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
13. Add 2 tbsp cream, 1 tsp kasuri methi, and 2 tbsp coriander.
14. Serve with roti or rice.

name: Mediterranean Diet Black Bean Brownies
ingredients: All Purpose Flour– ¼ cup. See post for alternatives.
Chocolate Chips– ½ cup plus additional as desired for topping.
Maple Syrup– ¼ cup. See post for alternatives.
Chopped Nuts– ¾ cup plus additional as desired for topping.
instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 and prep an baking dish (9 X 13 works well) for nonstick. Parchment paper should work in this recipe.
2. Rinse the black beans if you have not already done in cool water. Then allow the beans to drain.
3. In a medium mixing bowl whisk or mix together the unsweetened cocoa powder, baking powder, and flour.
4. Next, use a food processor or good blender process together the beans and the chocolate chips until blended together. Then add the banana, syrup, and oil and continue to process.
5. Add the dry ingredients from the first bowl, along with the vanilla extract, to the processor and process until smooth. The stir in the chopped nuts.
6. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Top with any desired extra chocolate chips and nuts. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Then allow the brownies to cool on a rack before cutting.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix quinoa, beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, feta and scallion.
2. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper together.
3. Pour dressing over salad and mix gently.

name: Mexican Papdi Chaat
instructions:
1. PrepDice bell pepper, onion, scallionsCook corn
2. Mix black beans, pinto beans, bell pepper, taco seasoning, corn, scallions, cumin powder, red chili powder, taco sauce, salsa, cilantro.
3. If serving immediately, add onion and cheese.
4. Serve with chutney and chips

name: Mexican Pinwheels
instructions:
1. Lay one tortilla flat and spread with a thin layer of spreadable cheese.
2. Next top with ~1/3 cup refried beans and spread flat. Continue layering with 1/4 avocado, 1/4 cup onion, 1/4 cup tomato or salsa, and 1/4 cup cilantro.
3. Use your hands to flatten all the ingredients down so it’s easier to roll. Then tightly roll from one end to the other and place seam side down on a cutting board. If any ingredients fall out of the tortilla when rolling, it’s OK! It’s a hefty pinwheel, so just scrape it aside and move along.
4. Starting in the center of the tortilla, use your hands to form and tighten the roll, moving outward toward the edges. This will help the fillings form together and make slicing easier.
5. Use a serrated knife (blunt-edge knives may smash the pinwheel), and slice into 1/2-inch slices – about 8-10.
6. Repeat the process with second tortilla and remaining ingredients. You should have ~20 pinwheels (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size).
7. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate for up to 2-3 days.

name: Mexican Risotto (IP)
ingredients: 1 packet chipotle corn from Trader Joe's
instructions:
1. PrepRoughly chop the cilantro.Grate the cheese.Leave frozen corn out at room temp to defrost a bit.
2. Make
3. Saute the onions in the oil and butter.
4. After onions have started to caramelize, add the rice, garlic, and jalapeño. Stir occasionally until the rice is translucent (1 - 2 min).
5. Add broth, taco seasoning, spices and set the instant pot to high pressure for 10 minutes.
6. Heat up the entire packet of chipotle corn with sauce pellets in pan on stove.
7. Manually release the pressure when done. Add the corn, cheese and half the cilantro. Stir to combine.
8. Top with cilantro to eat.

name: Mexican Sabudana Khichdi
ingredients: 2 scallions, green and white parts separated
instructions:
1. Quick Soak Sabudana
2. Heat 2-3 cups of water until it is boiling hot. It’s convenient to do this in a hot water kettle or right on the stove.
3. Rinse the sabudana thoroughly (wash about 2-3 times until you get clear liquid). Drain the liquid and place in a deep bowl.
4. Pour 1.5 cups of the hot water on top of the sabudana and let it sit for 30 minutes.
5. After 30 minutes, press a few of the sabudana between your fingers- they should be soft.
6. Drain the sabudana , rinse with cold water and transfer the sabudana to a wide colander or spread out in a large pan until the sabudana is completely dry (about 15-20 minutes).
7. Directions
8. In a large pot, heat the oil over medium high heat. Once the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds and scallion whites and stir.
9. Next add the bell peppers, turmeric, chili powder, taco seasoning and cook on low heat until the bell peppers are soft.
10. Once the peppers are soft, add the garlic and salt.
11. Add the sabudana, cilantro, lime juice, green scallions and mix until everything is well combined.I like my sabudana a little sticky and more soft so I cook it for an additional 5-6 minutes until I get that texture.
12. Remove from heat, top off cheese, a dollop of sour cream and enjoy!!

name: Mexican Street Corn Pasta Salad
instructions:
1. Prep:
2. Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water.
3. Mince garlic, jalapeño, and chop cilantro and scallions (reserve some for garnish).
4. Crumble cotija cheese (reserve some for garnish).
5. Cook:
6. Heat olive oil in a skillet, add corn in a single layer, season with salt and pepper, and cook undisturbed for 5 minutes until charred.
7. Add garlic, cook for 1–2 more minutes, and cool.
8. Blend sour cream, mayonnaise, chipotle peppers, lime juice, and zest to make the dressing. Season with salt and pepper.
9. Assemble:
10. Combine pasta, charred corn, jalapeño, cilantro, scallions, and cotija cheese in a large bowl.
11. Toss with the dressing and adjust seasoning if needed.
12. Garnish with reserved cilantro, scallions, and cotija cheese. Serve or refrigerate.

name: Mini Crustless Quiches
instructions:
1. Pre heat oven to 180c / 350F / Gas 4
2. Melt the butter in a frying pan and fry the onion, over a medium/low heat for two minutes, add the bell pepper and continue to saute one minute. Finally, add the spinach and fry for a further minute.
3. Whisk the eggs and cream together and then stir through the cheese.
4. Grease a 12 hole muffin tray or fill with greased silicon cases.
5. Add the vegetable mixture to the base of each muffin section.
6. Pour the egg mixture into each muffin section.
7. Bake for 25 mins, until set and golden.
8. Allow to cool slightly before removing from tin / case.

name: Mini Egg Muffins with Cheese and Veggies
ingredients: 1 tablespoon onion, peeled and grated (or ¼ teaspoon onion powder)
1/2cupbutternut squash, finely grated (or leftover diced roasted squash, minced broccoli, grated carrot, or minced spinach)
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 F and grease 12 mini muffin cups with nonstick spray very well.
2. Stir together all ingredients in a medium bowl.
3. Spoon into muffin cups, filling about to the brim.
4. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until firm to the touch and golden brown around the edges.
5. Let cool for about 5 minutes in the pan before serving to allow them to firm up a bit. Use a paring knife around the edges to help remove them if needed Serve warm or at room temperature.
6. You can also pack these egg and cheese mini muffins in a packed daycare lunch or school lunch.
7. Chop them up over salads for your own lunch.
8. Try mozzarella instead of cheddar.
9. Try ricotta instead of cottage cheese.
10. Double the recipe and bake a whole pan of 24 mini muffins at once.

name: Moong Dal Chilla
instructions:
1. Add moong dal to a medium bowl. Rinse the moong dal and soak for 3+ hours (ideally overnight).
2. If desired, chop onion, grate carrot and paneer.
3. Drain the water. Transfer dal to a blender. Add about ⅔ cup water. Blend to make a smooth batter.
4. Transfer the batter to a bowl. Add green chili, ginger, onion, carrot, cilantro, salt, turmeric and red chili powder. Mix well, and add 1-2 tablespoons more water if needed. Make sure the batter is not too thick or too runny, it should have a pouring consistency.
5. Make chilla like you would make dosa, adding grated paneer when semi-solid.
6. Serve right way with chutney or tomato ketchup, and a cup of chai!

name: Moroccan Chickpea Stew
instructions:
1. Make the quinoa using the stovetop method or Instant Pot method. When it’s done, sprinkle with a little kosher salt to taste.
2. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Chop the sweet potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large pot, heat the olive oil. Sauté the onion for about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and sauté about 1 minute.
4. Stir in the paprika, cumin, coriander, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, kosher salt, black pepper, andcayenne pepper. Stir about 30 seconds, then add diced tomatoes and broth.
5. Bring to a boil, then add sweet potatoes and drained and rinsed chickpeas. Simmer 25 to 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the spinach in the last 2 minutes.
6. Serve over the quinoa, garnished with chopped cilantro, fresh squeezed lemon juice, and a dollop of Greek yogurt.

name: No-Bake Chocolate Granola Bars
instructions:
1. Line an 8×8-inch pan with parchment paper, leaving enough on the sides for you to lift the bars out of the pan.
2. Add the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and brown rice syrup to a large heat-proof bowl. Heat in the microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, stopping to stir. (It should take a minute).
3. Add the cereal, oats, cereal, and dried cherries.
4. Stir with a wooden spoon, then use your (clean) hands to massage the ingredients together until well incorporated.
5. Pour into pan and use your hands to press down firmly and evenly.
6. Chill for 10-20 minutes, use the parchment to remove from the pan, and slice into bars. Serve chilled (they will be firmer) or at room temperature.

name: One Pan Enchilada Quinoa
instructions:
1. Chop onion, peppers.
2. 1 cup quinoa is 3 kid servings. Make double if the adults are also eating
3. Heat a large skillet or pot over medium high heat and add oil.
4. Add cumin to the pan and let splutter. Add jalapeños and cook for about 1 minute.
5. Add onions, peppers, garlic and taco seasoning to the pan and saute until onions and peppers are slightly softened after 8 minutes
6. Add quinoa, enchilada sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover lid and let cook for about 15 minutes. Check in between and stir if necessary (add splash of water if needed).
7. Once the quinoa has cooked, add in the scallions, cheese, sour cream and serve immediately while hot!

name: One Pot Broccoli Cheddar Quinoa
instructions:
1. The quantities in this are for 4-5 adult servings. Plan for two dinners or cut in half.
2. Chop onion, carrots and broccoli before turning on IP.
3. Turn the Instant Pot onto saute mode and add oil and butter. Once the butter is melted, add the diced onions and carrots and stir until slightly softened (about 3-4 minutes).
4. Heat 1L+ water for broth.
5. Add the garlic, cumin powder, salt, and quinoa and stir for 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined.
6. Add the broth, mix again and then place the broccoli florets directly on top of the mixture (without mixing them in).
7. Switch the Instant Pot to High Pressure mode and set timer for 1 minute. Quick Release after 5 minutes. Total time should be roughly 10 minutes
8. Open the pot, switch the IP to saute mode and add in the milk. Stir and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes so the quinoa slightly thickens. Add cheese and stir until well combined. Taste for salt and add extra if needed. (The quinoa will thicken as it sits for a few minutes)
9. If you want to make this spicy, add a few dashes of crushed red chili flakes or sriracha.
10. Serve hot and enjoy! Store refrigerated for up to 3-4 days.

name: Oven-Baked Crispy Black Bean Tacos
instructions:
1. **For the Black Bean Tacos:**Preheat oven to 450F. Line a baking sheet pan with parchment paper.
2. In a skillet over medium high heat, add the olive oil to heat up for 1 minute.
3. Add the minced garlic, onion, and jalapeño peppers. Sauce for 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the drained black beans and tomato paste. Stir to combine.
5. Add 1 cup water, stir to combine, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer.
6. Using a fork, lightly smash the black beans. Add more water as necessary to keep the black beans moist but not liquid-y.
7. Add the taco seasoning, lime juice, and salt and black pepper to taste.
8. Evenly distribute and spread over the tortillas. Place on the prepared baking pan.
9. Brush each tortilla with olive oil.
10. Bake for 8-10 minutes, until lightly golden brown, flip the tortillas over and bake another 8-10 minutes. Enjoy warm!
11. **For the Cilantro Yogurt Sauce:**Blend all ingredients together in a food processor or high speed blender until smooth and creamy. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the fridge up to 4 days.

name: Pachai Payaru, Moong Dal Sundal
instructions:
1. Heat heavy bottom pan, add oil, splutter mustard, followed by urad dal, asafoetida, red chilli and curry leaves.
2. Add ginger, coriander leaves and give it a fry.
3. In goes cooked green gram, drain water if any. Toss well.
4. Lastly top with grated coconut and mix. Cook for a minute and switch off the flame.

name: Palak Paneer Spinach
instructions:
1. PrepCut the onion, bell pepper, tomato.Cube the paneer
2. CookPrep the ice cold water in a bowl to the side.
3. Heat up water in a large pot until it comes to rolling boil.
4. Turn off the flame and drop in the spinach.
5. Let it sit in the hot water for 2 minutes or until the leaves are blanched well.
6. After the 2 minutes are up, drop the palak leaves into ice-cold water. This helps to retain bright green colour.
7. Now transfer the blanched palak into the mixie.
8. Add 2 cloves garlic, ginger, 3 green chilies.
9. Blend to smooth puree without adding any water, and keep aside.
10. In a large kadai, heat 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp butter, 1 dried red chilli, 1 tsp cumin powder and 1 bay leaf. Saute on low flame until the spices turn aromatic.
11. Add 1 onion, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste and saute until onions turn golden brown.
12. Still on low, add turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder and salt. Saute until the spices turn aromatic.
13. Add the bell pepper and sauté until the capsicum shrinks slightly.
14. Add 1 tomato and cook until the tomato turns soft and mushy.
15. Add in prepared palak puree and cook for 5-10 minutes
16. Mix cream/milk and crumbed paneer. Sauce the cubed paneer with spices as desired.
17. Add 1 cup water to the spinach puree and adjust the consistency as required.
18. Add the milk/paneer into the mix and stir well making sure the consistency is appropriate.
19. Add cubed paneer and simmer for 2 minutes.
20. Add ½ tsp garam masala and 1 tsp kasuri methi
21. Enjoy with chapati or rice.

name: Panchmel Dal
instructions:
1. Wash the lentils with water and keep aside. Finely dice onion and tomato. Set water in kettle for boiling.
2. Start the instant pot in sauté mode and heat the ghee/oil in it.
3. Add cumin, red chilies, green chili and asafoetida. Allow them to cook for 30 seconds while stirring constantly.
4. Then add diced onion and grated ginger. Sauté until onions are translucent for about 3 minutes.
5. Now add tomatoes and sauté for 3 minutes until tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add all the spices and give it a stir.
6. Add washed lentils and 4 cups water. Press CANCEL and close the instant pot lid with vent in sealing position.
7. Press MANUAL or PRESSURE COOK mode for 8 minutes and let the pressure release naturally (NPR)
8. Open the lid, add garam masala and lime juice.
9. Garnish with cilantro and serve. Enjoy!
10. Stovetop Method
11. Follow the same steps as above to cook the dal in a stovetop pressure cooker. Pressure cook for 3-4 whistles until the dal is cooked and soft. Then let the pressure release naturally. Stir in garam masala and lime juice. Garnish with cilantro and serve!

name: Paneeer & Corn Utthapam
ingredients: Red chili powder or chili flakes
instructions:
1. Mix all and keep aside for 10 minutes, add a spoon or two water if needed
2. Cut 2 large capsicum into little thick slices
3. Take a non stick or a cast iron pan, spread oil once heats, layer the rings fill with uttapam batter properly
4. Let cook in low medium flame until browns, flip and cook the other side as well. It should brown properly
5. Enjoy with ketchup or chutney

name: Paruppu Thogayal
instructions:
1. Fry toor dal with red chillies, with little oil till golden brown in medium flame or low flame.
2. Cool down and grind it to a coarse paste with added salt, peeled garlic and required.
3. You can add 2 tablespoon of coconut while grinding, that will give you an enhanced taste!
4. A pinch of tamarind is also a good idea.
5. To eat with rice, mix this paste with rice and little sesame oil or you can have as an accompaniment for vatral kuzhambu rice or curd rice!

name: Paruppu Usili
instructions:
1. To begin making the Green Beans Paruppu Usili Recipe, soak the toor dal in water for about 1 hour.
2. Once the dal is soaked until soft; drain the excess water.
3. Into a food processor/mixer, add in the toor dal, turmeric powder and dried red chillies and blend to make a coarse mixture. You want the Paruppu Usili to have a coarse texture when steamed.
4. Grease the steamer plates or idli plates with a oil and spoon the ground paruppu usili mixture into the steamer plates.
5. Place the filled steamer plates into the steamer and steam for 10 minutes on high heat. Once steamed, turn off the heat and keep aside and allow it to cool.
6. Once the cooled, transfer to a large mixing bowl and crumble the steamed paruppu - this mixture is called the paruppu usili (crumbled dal). Keep this aside.
7. The next step is to cook the green beans.
8. In a pressure cooker, add the chopped green beans along with 2 tablespoons of water. Sprinkle in a little salt.
9. Pressure cook the green beans for 2 whistles on high heat, turn off the heat and run the pressure cooker under water to release pressure immediately. The beans will be cooked perfectly without loss of colour and nutrition.
10. Place a wok or kadai on medium heat and add a teaspoon of oil. Once the oil is hot, add mustard seeds and urad dal and allow it to crackle and the dal to turn golden brown.
11. After the seeds have crackled, add asafoetida, the curry leaves and the steamed paruppu usili and mix thoroughly.
12. Saute the dal in the oil for a good 3 to 4 minutes until it gets a perfect crumbly texture. Once you have a good texture, stir in the green beans and turn off the heat. Check the salt and adjust to taste accordingly.
13. Serve with Vathal Kuzhambu Recipe and Rice for a weekday meal.

name: Pasta with Veggie Sauce
instructions:
1. Soak handful or two of cashews in small stainless steel bowl
2. Peel and quarter all veggies (can also use minimal carrot)
3. Boil water for pasta (1L+)
4. Place 2 cups water in IP pot with trivet on top
5. Balance the veggies on top of trivet and nut bowl on top of that
6. Set IP on manual for 5 minutes (double check online)
7. Cook pasta while IP is working
8. Quick release IP once done
9. Blend all veggies and nuts
10. Add salt, cumin powder, pepper and other spices as needed to make it tasty
11. Mix sauce with pasta and serve

name: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: 1.5 cups mixed vegetables: carrot, peas, beets, cauliflower
instructions:
1. Pressure cook peeled, chopped potatoes and other chopped veggies together with little water, upto 3 whistles in pressure cooker.
2. Heat a broad pan with butter, fry onion until translucent.
3. After that add ginger garlic paste, fry till raw smell of the ginger garlic paste goes off.
4. Following it, add tomatoes, salt, pav Bhaji masala and red chilli powder.
5. Fry till tomatoes turns soft and mushy.
6. Then add the capsicum and fry for a minute.
7. Then add all the veggies, mash well.
8. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes and mash with a ladle so that all the veggies get mixed well. Switch off stove.
9. Finally add butter, lemon juice if desired. Bhaji is ready now to serve with pav.
10. Garnish with finely chopped onion,coriander leaves and squeeze lemon as needed and spread the bhaji in between a well golden roasted buns/Pav/bread and enjoy hot!

name: Peanut Chutney
instructions:
1. Dry roast peanuts in low flame to ensure even roasting.
2. Once its is crisp, transfer to a plate for cooling and roast channa and urad dal with a teaspoon of oil.
3. Lastly add green chillies and fry.
4. Cool everything.
5. Remove the skin of the peanuts completely.
6. Place in the mixer and grind with ginger (if desired), salt and water. Grind smoothly.
7. Adjust water consistency to make it runny.
8. Temper: oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaf.
9. Mix well.

name: Pesarattu
instructions:
1. Rinse well a few times until the water runs clear.
2. Pour fresh water and soak in enough water for about 4 to 6 hours. If using rice soak it along with dal. I don’t use rice most of the times.
3. Once the green gram is soaked, rinse them well.
4. Blend with ginger, salt, green chilies, cumin seeds.
5. Chop onions. Sauté with ghee, cumin, green chilies until slightly brown
6. When making the peasrattu, sprinkle fried onions on topping
7. To make the next one, ensure the pan is not very hot. If it is too hot, reduce the flame or turn off the stove for a while and then make the next one.
8. If you are unable to spread the batter on the tawa it means the batter is very thick. Add back to the blender with little water and blend again. Adding water directly to the batter most times doesn’t yield me good ones.

name: Pesto Gnocchi
instructions:
1. Boil gnocchi according to package directions.
2. Drain and toss with pesto sauce.

name: Pickled Red Onions
instructions:
1. Thinly slice the onions (it's helpful to use a mandoline), and divide the onions between 2 (16-ounce) jars or 3 (10-ounce) jars. Place the garlic and peppercorns in each jar, if using
2. Heat the vinegar, water, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar and salt dissolve, about 1 minute. Let cool and pour over the onions. Set aside to cool to room temperature, then store the onions in the fridge.
3. Your pickled onions will be ready to eat once they're bright pink and tender - about 1 hour for very thinly sliced onions, or overnight for thicker sliced onions. They will keep in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

name: Pinto Bean Casserole
instructions:
1. Add onion, bell peppers, garlic and olive oil to a large pan over medium heat. Saute until onions are translucent, about 5-10 minutes.
2. Add pinto beans, diced tomatoes, corn, baby spinach and all spices (chili powder through black pepper). Saute another 10-15 minutes until everything is cooked through. Stir in quinoa.
3. Squeeze lime juice on top and stir to combine. Serve warm, topped with avocado, cilantro and greek yogurt.

name: Pizza Muffins (with Veggies!)
ingredients: ¼cup melted and slightly cooled butter or neutral oil
¼cup diced pepperoni, plus 2 tablespoons diced pepperoni (optional)
Marinara or pizza sauce (warmed for dipping, optional but recommended)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Stir together the wet ingredients in a large bowl.
3. Fold in the dry ingredients, reserving some of the pepperoni.
4. Portion out into a greased muffin tin and top with pepperoni.
5. Bake and serve or store.
6. AD
7. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and grease a standard muffin tin well with nonstick spray.
8. Add the milk, carrot, cheeses, butter, pepperoni (reserving the 2 tablespoons), and egg to a medium bowl. Stir together.
9. Stir in the flours, baking powder, baking soda, pizza seasoning, and salt.
10. Divide batter among the prepared muffin tin, using a heaping ¼ cup in each. Top each with pepperoni.
11. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until lightly golden brown around the edges and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean. (There may be some melted cheese on it, though!)
12. Let cool in the pan for 2-5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. You may need to use a paring knife around the edges of the muffins to help remove them from the pan.
13. Serve slightly warm.

name: Poblano Cream Enchilada Sauce
instructions:
1. Roasting the Poblano Peppers
2. Set your oven to a High Broil setting.
3. Brush the poblano peppers lightly with oil and broil on the top most rack, turning the peppers every 4-6 minutes or until all sides are charred and blackened.
4. Once the peppers are charred on each side remove them into a heat safe bowl or baking dish and cover tightly to sweat the peppers for about 5 minutes.
5. Uncover the peppers and peel off as much of the charred skin and the seeds as you can .
6. Discard the charred skin and seeds, roughly chop the peppers and set aside.
7. Make the Sauce
8. In a heavy bottom pot heat the butter and garlic over medium heat and add the flour.
9. Make a roux by constantly stirring the butter & flour mixture until it has a nutty fragrance and is golden in color, about 3 minutes.
10. Slowly whisk in the chicken broth in small amounts until the mixture is thick and bubbly.
11. Once you have added all of the broth, add the sour cream, poblano peppers, cilantro, cumin & salt. Stir until smooth and all ingredients are incorporated.
12. Take the pot off the stove and using an electric hand blender, blend the sauce until it is smooth and creamy. If you do not have an electric hand blender, work in batches and blend the cooled sauce in a regular blender carefully.
13. Add queso fresco to the sauce and set aside.
14. To assemble the enchiladas:
15. Heat a skillet on medium low, add 1 tsp of oil and add two or three flour tortillas to the pan depending on how big your pan is.
16. Working quickly, add about ¼ cup shredded chicken in the middle of the tortilla, top with a handful of the monterey jack cheese and seal the enchilada closed.
17. Lightly brown the wrapped enchiladas until they are golden brown on both sides. Remove from pan and place them in a an oven proof baking dish.
18. Continue to do this for the rest of the chicken & tortillas.
19. Place all of the enchiladas in an oven proof baking dish and poor the sauce generously over the top.
20. Bake for 15 minutes on 375 degrees or until hot and bubbly!
21. Garnish with sliced green onion, tomatoes, & queso fresco !

name: Pomegranate Orange Muffins
ingredients: Cook Mode Prevent your screen from going dark
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease muffin pans.
2. In a small bowl soak oats in orange juice and water for 15 minutes.
3. In a large bowl cream together butter, vanilla, and sugars. Beat in eggs and oat mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, blend flour, baking powder, soda, salt, and nutmeg. Stir into batter. Stir in pomegranate seeds and orange zest. Spoon batter into prepared muffin pans, filling almost to the top.
5. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until golden brown, about 20 minutes. 1 muffin has 140 calories and 3g fat.

name: Porridge Fingers
instructions:
1. Mix ingredients together. For the plain version this will just be milk and oats, for the flavoured versions it will include all the other ingredients.
2. Allow the mixture to sit for a couple of minutes, until mushy.
3. Press the mixture into a small, flat-bottomed microwavable dish. Use the back of a spoon to do this until the mixture is flat.
4. Microwave for 2 mins on high. The cooked mixture will be soft but you should be able to cut through it.
5. Cut the fingers while still hot and serve once cooled.
6. STORAGE INSTRUCTIONS
7. Store in airtight container in fridge for 1-2 days and in freezer for up to one month.

name: Pretzel Bites with Cheese Sauce
instructions:
1. **Pretzel Bite- Instructions**
2. Preheat the oven to 450 degree F. Cover baking sheet with parchment paper
3. Warm water in a pot until lukewarm. Add it to  yeast and whisk.
4. Sprinkle  sugar in it and whisk again. Set aside to let the yeast “bloom.”
5. Measure flour,  salt, and add to a mixing bowl with yeast mix.
6. If dough is too dry, add more water 1 tablespoon at a time and if the dough is too wet, add more flour 1 tablespoon at a time. Place dough in a lightly oiled large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise to minimum 10 min
7. Pour 6 cups of water into the pot and add baking soda. Bring to a boil over high heat.
8. Divide the dough into 3 pieces. Roll each piece into a 20 to 24-inch long rope. Cut into bite-size pieces.
9. Using a slotted spoon, gently place the bite size pieces  into the boiling water for 45 seconds. Remove the pretzels with a slotted spoon and drain well. Place onto the parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
10. Melt butter in the oven. Generously brush with melted butter on all sides. Sprinkle with coarse salt.
11. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the pretzels are golden brown. While the preServe with Sauce for dipping!
12. **Cheese sauce**In a small saucepan set over medium heat, melt the butter. Whisk in the flour and cook for 30 seconds, whisking constantly.
13. Slowly whisk in the milk until no lumps of flour remain.
14. Stirring constantly, bring the milk to a simmer over medium-low heat until it thickens, about 3 to 5 minutes.
15. Remove the pan from the stove and stir in the shredded cheese until all of the cheese has melted.
16. Add a pinch of salt, if needed. Serve warm.

name: Protein Banana Bread
ingredients: ½cup creamy peanut butter (or melted unsalted butter)
⅓cup maple syrup (or sugar plus 2 tablespoons milk)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Add the wet ingredients, including the mashed banana, to a large mixing bowl.
3. Stir together.
4. Gently stir in the dry ingredients.
5. Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake until a toothpick or cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen, then cool on a wire rack before slicing.
7. AD
8. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Coat a mini loaf pan or standard 9×5-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray.
9. In a large bowl, stir together the yogurt, banana, maple syrup, peanut butter, eggs, and vanilla.
10. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
11. Gently stir the yogurt mixture into the flour mixture.
12. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
13. Bake for 26-28 minutes if using a mini loaf pan or until the edges are lightly golden brown and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes in the pan, then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack before slicing.
14. To make in a standard 9×5-inch baking loaf pan, reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F and bake for 55-60 minutes. Towards the end of baking, if the bread is browning a lot on top, cover with foil and continue baking.

name: Protein Banana Muffins
instructions:
1. Prep:
2. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
3. Grease a standard 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray or line with paper liners.
4. Cook:
5. In a large bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, mashed bananas, peanut butter, maple syrup, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth.
6. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt to the wet ingredients. If using protein powder or other optional add-ins like chocolate chips or blueberries, fold them in now. Stir gently until just combined; avoid overmixing.
7. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups, filling each about three-quarters full.
8. Bake for 14-16 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Enjoy your muffins!

name: Puree Pancakes
instructions:
1. Combine all dry ingredients and mix together well with fork or whisk.
2. Add beaten egg, oil, vanilla if using, baby food, and mix.
3. Add enough milk to give the batter the consistency you like; about a half cup should be right. The thicker the batter, the thicker your pancakes, the thinner, obviously, the thinner the pancakes will be.
4. Heat a griddle or skillet to medium heat. When tiny droplets of water sizzle and evaporate the griddle is hot enough. You can either lightly oil the griddle or use non stick cooking spray.
5. Drop a little less than 1/4 cup of batter on the griddle at a time.
6. Note: using baby food makes the batter a little more dense than regular pancakes, so they will need a little longer to cook to avoid being soggy in the middle, so either reduce the heat and cook them longer or make smaller pancakes. Enjoy!

name: Quick Refried Bean Tacos
ingredients: Optional: Shredded cheese, feta or queso fresco, sour cream,
instructions:
1. Make the filling: Mince the garlic. In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant but not yet browned (or skip this step and use garlic powder instead). Heat the refried beans, cumin and kosher salt until warmed, about 3 minutes. Taste and adjust flavors as desired.
2. Prep the veggies: Chop the lettuce. Dice the bell pepper. Prep the other toppings as desired. (If using pickled red onions, it’s easiest to make them in advance.)
3. Warm the tortillas: Warm and char the tortillas by placing them on an open gas flame on medium for a few seconds per side, flipping with tongs, until they are slightly blackened and warm. (See How to Warm Tortillas.)
4. Serve: Place the refried beans in the tortillas, then top with toppings and enjoy.

name: Quick Tortilla Pizzas
ingredients: 1cuppizza toppings (as desired such as pepperoni, olives, precooked broccoli, or thinly sliced mushrooms)
instructions:
1. Here’s a peek at how to make this recipe so you know what to expect from the process. Scroll down to the end of this post for the specific amounts and the timing.
2. Preheat the oven and line baking sheets with parchment paper for easy cleanup. Place the tortillas onto baking sheets. Top with pizza sauce, mozzarella, Parmesan, and any desired toppings.
3. Bake until warmed through and the cheese is just golden brown. Serve warm, slicing into wedges so it’s easy to eat.
4. How to Store
5. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Reheat on a plate in the microwave for 30 seconds or heat through in a 375-degree-F oven.
6. Best Tips for Success
7. Use any type of tortilla you prefer. I usually use fajita-size whole wheat or regular flour ones, but the method is versatile.
8. Use dairy-free cheese as needed.
9. Serve with simple sides such as fruit, applesauce, salad, or roasted broccoli.
10. Fold the pizza in half to serve like a pizza quesadilla.
11. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
12. Place the tortillas onto 2 rimmed baking sheets. Top each with pizza sauce, spreading just to the edges, and the mozzarella, Parmesan, and any desired toppings.
13. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until warmed through and the cheese is just golden brown.
14. Serve warm, slicing up into wedges.

name: Quinoa Fried Rice
ingredients: 1½cups uncooked SimplyNature Organic Quinoa, or 5 cups cooked day old quinoa
2 tablespoons SimplyNature Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
6 SimplyNature Organic Cage Free Brown Eggs*
5 ounces (about 5 cups) SimplyNature Mixed Greens: Baby Green Kale, Baby Spinach and Baby Chard (or chopped kale or chard)
4 tablespoons Fusia Soy Sauce or liquid aminos
instructions:
1. Cook the quinoa (or use Instant Pot quinoa OR if you have cooked quinoa, skip to Step 2).
2. Cool the quinoa by spreading it into a single layer on a baking sheet and freeze for 5 to 10 minutes. If making in advance, refrigerate the quinoa until serving.
3. Slice the green onions; reserve the dark green portions for a garnish.
4. Dice the onion and carrots.
5. In a very large skillet, heat the oil over medium high heat. Add the onion and white and light green portions of the green onions and sauté until translucent, about 3 minutes, then add the carrots and sauté for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté for 2 minutes.
6. Add the quinoa and salt and stir to combine.
7. Make a well in the quinoa, exposing the pan, and crack the eggs into the pan.
8. Scramble the eggs and cook for several minutes until they are soft, then stir them into the quinoa (resist the urge to stir them into the quinoa until they are cooked). Add the baby greens and continue to stir until they are fully wilted, about 1 to 2 minutes. Turn off the heat, stir in the soy sauce and green onion tops and mix. Taste and add additional salt as desired (we added an additional ¼ teaspoon as our soy sauce was low sodium).
9. If desired, drizzle with sriracha and/or additional soy sauce. Serving suggestion: serve with Easy Edamame for a filling meal.

name: Ragda Patty
instructions:
1. pressure cook vatana, potato, turmeric, salt and water for 5 whistles.
2. Chop one onion and two tomatoes.
3. now in a large kadai heat 3 tsp oil and saute 1 onion, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste and 1 chilli.
4. also saute 1 tomato until it turns soft and mushy.
5. furthermore add ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp chilli powder, ½ tsp coriander powder, ¼ tsp cumin powder, ¼ tsp garam masala and ¼ tsp salt.
6. saute on low flame until the oil is released from sides.
7. now add boiled peas and mix well.
8. boil for 5 minutes or until the spices is absorbed.
9. mash the peas and potato slightly, to thicken the consistency.
10. Top with cilantro

name: Rainbow Tacos
instructions: 1. Saute chopped veggies in oil2. Add beans, chili powder, cumin and salt3. Add water to cover4. Bring to a boil and cook uncovered until water reduces. Mixture should be thick and well combined5. Service with tortillas and optional rainbow toppings

name: Rajma Nachos
instructions:
1. Start the instant pot in Saute (More) mode and let it heat until it displays HOT. Add oil, cumin seeds and green chili.
2. Add onions, ginger and garlic. Stir and saute for about 3 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes and spices to the instant pot. Stir and saute for 2 more minutes.
4. Drain the old soaking water from the soaked beans and discard. Add the beans and the water (for cooking) to the instant pot. Stir it all up.
5. Close the lid with vent in sealing position. Change the setting to "Bean/Chili" mode. This will set the timer to 30 minutes at high pressure cooking. Once the instant pot beeps, let the pressure release naturally and then open the lid. If using canned beans, use 6 min instead of 30 and reduce water to 1 cup.
6. Add lime juice and cilantro and stir the rajma.
7. Serve on top of chips with cheese, greek yogurt/sour cream, lettuce, tomatoes, salsa as toppings.

name: Rasam Recipe
instructions:
1. Rinse ½ cup toor dal until the water runs clear.
2. Chop 2 medium tomatoes.
3. In a pressure cooker, add the rinsed dal, chopped tomatoes, 1½ cups water, 1 tsp tamarind concentrate, slit green chilies, 1 tsp jaggery, 1 tsp rasam powder, and salt.
4. Close the lid and cook on medium heat for 3 to 4 whistles.
5. Let the pressure release naturally. Open the lid and gently mash the dal and tomatoes.
6. In a small pan, heat 1 tsp ghee. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
7. Add cumin seeds, dried red chili, a pinch of hing, and curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds until fragrant.
8. Pour the tempering into the rasam. Stir to combine.
9. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.

name: Rasam Rice with Beetroot Kai
ingredients: 1/2 tsp rasam powder (or use more black pepper + cumin if unavailable)
instructions:
1. Chop 1 medium tomato.
2. Crush 2 garlic cloves.
3. Peel and dice 1 medium beetroot into small cubes.
4. Cook 1 cup rice and keep it ready (preferably slightly mushy, like for rasam rice).
5. In a pot, mix 1 tsp tamarind concentrate with 3 cups water.
6. Add chopped tomato, crushed garlic, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp rasam powder, and salt.
7. Let it simmer on medium heat for 10–12 minutes until tomatoes soften and flavors blend. Don't boil too hard—rasam should be light.
8. In a small pan, heat 1 tsp ghee or oil.
9. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds. When they splutter, add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 red chilli, pinch of hing, and curry leaves.
10. Pour this tempering into the simmering rasam. Turn off heat.
11. Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan.
12. Add diced beetroot and sauté on medium heat for 5–6 minutes.
13. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp red chilli powder, and salt.
14. Stir and cook until beetroot is tender (about 6–8 more minutes, adding a splash of water if needed).
15. In a bowl or plate, mix cooked rice with hot rasam.
16. Top or serve it with the sautéed beetroot kai on the side or mixed in.

name: Rasam Rice with Broccoli Kai
ingredients: 1/2 tsp rasam powder (or use more black pepper + cumin if unavailable)
instructions:
1. Chop 1 medium tomato.
2. Crush 2 garlic cloves.
3. Cut 1/2 head of broccoli into small florets.
4. Cook 1 cup rice and keep it ready (preferably slightly mushy, like for rasam rice).
5. In a pot, mix 1 tsp tamarind concentrate with 3 cups water.
6. Add chopped tomato, crushed garlic, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp rasam powder, and salt.
7. Let it simmer on medium heat for 10–12 minutes until tomatoes soften and flavors blend. Don't boil too hard—rasam should be light.
8. In a small pan, heat 1 tsp ghee or oil.
9. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds. When they splutter, add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 red chilli, pinch of hing, and curry leaves.
10. Pour this tempering into the simmering rasam. Turn off heat.
11. Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan.
12. Add broccoli florets and sauté on medium heat for 4–5 minutes.
13. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp red chilli powder, and salt.
14. Stir and cook until broccoli is tender but not mushy (about 3–4 more minutes).
15. In a bowl or plate, mix cooked rice with hot rasam.
16. Top or serve it with the sautéed broccoli kai on the side or mixed in.

name: Rasam Rice with Carrot Kai
ingredients: 1/2 tsp rasam powder (or use more black pepper + cumin if unavailable)
instructions:
1. Chop 1 medium tomato.
2. Crush 2 garlic cloves.
3. Peel and dice 2 medium carrots into small cubes.
4. Cook 1 cup rice and keep it ready (preferably slightly mushy, like for rasam rice).
5. In a pot, mix 1 tsp tamarind concentrate with 3 cups water.
6. Add chopped tomato, crushed garlic, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp rasam powder, and salt.
7. Let it simmer on medium heat for 10–12 minutes until tomatoes soften and flavors blend. Don't boil too hard—rasam should be light.
8. In a small pan, heat 1 tsp ghee or oil.
9. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds. When they splutter, add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 red chilli, pinch of hing, and curry leaves.
10. Pour this tempering into the simmering rasam. Turn off heat.
11. Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan.
12. Add diced carrots and sauté on medium heat for 4–5 minutes.
13. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp red chilli powder, and salt.
14. Stir and cook until carrots are tender (about 5–6 more minutes).
15. In a bowl or plate, mix cooked rice with hot rasam.
16. Top or serve it with the sautéed carrot kai on the side or mixed in.

name: Refried Bean Burrito
ingredients: ⅔cup refried beans, ⅓ cup or 5 tablespoons per burrito
½cup cooked brown rice, ¼ cup or 4 tablespoons per burrito
½avocado, halved, pitted, peeled, and sliced (about 3 to 4 slices per burrito)
¼cup crumbled queso cotija, 2 tablespoons per burrito
1 teaspoon vegetable oil, optional (if you want to pan fry the burritos)
instructions:
1. Heat olive oil
2. Add shallot, bell pepper, corn, chili powder, cumin and a pinch each of salt and black pepper.
3. Cook, stirring every so often, for 3 to 5 minutes or until tender crisp. Stir in garlic.
4. To assemble each burrito, layer refried beans in the centre of the tortilla (about ⅓ cup per burrito), about ¼ cup of cooked rice on top, ½ of pepper mixture, a few slices of avocado and about 2 tablespoons of crumbled cheese per burrito.
5. To fold the burritos: For each one, bring one side of the tortilla up over the ingredients (covering them), fold in each side, then begin to tightly roll the burrito (keeping everything tucked in as you roll, so it's compact). Alternatively, you can fold the burrito your favourite way. Serve and enjoy! This burrito is delicious served with your favourite chips and salsa (or enjoy the burrito as is).
6. Optional (but delicious): Wipe out the frying pan and lightly grease with vegetable oil. Place over medium heat. Add burritos to the pan and warm for about 2 minutes per side.

name: Romesco Gnocchi
instructions:
1. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil, seasoned with about 1 tablespoon kosher salt.
2. Make the gnocchi sauce: Peel the garlic. In a blender or food processor, process all ingredients until smooth. Taste and add additional seasonings if desired.
3. Once the water is boiling, add the gnocchi and boil until they float, about 2 to 3 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, line a colander with spinach leaves. When the gnocchi are done, pour them into the colander with the spinach so that the boiling water wilts the spinach. Then pour the cooked gnocchi and spinach back into the pot and stir to a few times to evenly distribute the spinach.
5. Add 1 cup of the romesco sauce to the pot and stir. (Reserve and refrigerate the remaining 1 ½ cups for up to 1 week.)
6. For vegan, top with fresh ground black pepper. For vegetarian, top with black pepper and feta crumbles. If desired, add a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Romesco Pasta Sauce
instructions:
1. Prep:Preheat your oven to 180°C (356°F).
2. Place the halved red peppers, tomatoes on baking tray
3. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
4. Bake for about 25 minutes.
5. CookBlend the veggies and 8 garlic cloves.
6. Add tofu, a splash of olive oil, a handful of fresh parsley, 3 tablespoons of nutritional yeast, 1/3 cup of raw almonds, and the juice of one lemon.
7. Season again with a bit of salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add vegetable broth to help blend everything to a smooth consistency. You can adjust the amount to make the sauce as thick or thin as you like.
9. Use the sauce with cooked chickpeas, drizzled over yogurt, mixed with broccoli pesto, or as a creamy pasta sauce.
10. For a gourmet touch, sprinkle toasted almond flakes and vegan parmesan on top before serving.

name: Salted Tahini Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat together the oats, almond flour, baking soda, salt, coconut oil, tahini, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla. Fold in the chocolate chips/chunks.
3. Scoop the dough out into rounded tablespoon size balls - the dough will be a little wet. Place 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheet.
4. Bake 10-12 minutes, until browning on the edges, but not fully set in the center. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with flaky salt. Eat warm (highly recommend) or let cool and store in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Sambar Rice
ingredients: ¾ cup toor dal (split pigeon peas)
instructions:
For the Sambar Rice:
Wash ¾ cup toor dal and pressure cook it with 2 cups water and ¼ tsp turmeric for 3–4 whistles until soft.
Wash 1 cup rice and cook it separately with 2–2½ cups water until soft (slightly mushy is okay for sambar rice).
Slice 1 medium onion and chop 1 medium tomato.
Cut 1–2 drumsticks (murungakkai) into 2-inch pieces.
Sambar Rice:
In a large pan, heat 2 tsp oil or ghee. Add ½ tsp mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add a pinch of hing and a few curry leaves.
Add the sliced onion and sauté for 2–3 minutes until slightly soft.
Add the chopped tomato and 1 chopped green chili (if using). Cook until the tomato turns soft.
Add the drumstick pieces and about 1 cup water. Let it cook for 7–10 minutes until drumsticks are soft.
Stir in 1½ tbsp sambar powder, 1 tsp tamarind concentrate, and salt. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Add the mashed toor dal and cooked rice. Mix well. Adjust water if needed to get a soft, semi-liquid consistency.
Let it simmer for 5 more minutes. Taste and adjust salt or tamarind.
Turn off heat and drizzle ghee on top if you like.

name: Samosa Grilled Cheese
instructions:
1. Peel, boil and dice potatoes.
2. In a non stick skillet add 2 tbsp oil over medium high heat.
3. Once the oil is hot add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, hing and let the seeds crackle.
4. Add the diced onions and cook until onions are translucent and golden around the edges.
5. Lower the heat slightly and add the grated garlic, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander cumin powder, garam masala powder and mix well.
6. Add the potatoes, salt, and continue to stir and combine all ingredients gently until everything is evenly incorporated
7. Using the back of a spoon or a potato masher, gently smash the potatoes if they are too large and continue to stir.
8. Remove from heat.
9. Assembly:
10. In a medium size skillet melt over medium heat, add 1/2 tablespoon of butter until it is foamy and melted.
11. Lay two slices of bread down on the pan and spread one of the slices with roughly 1 tablespoon of cilantro chutney and the other slice with about 1 tablespoon of apple butter chutney.
12. Add a slice of cheese or handful of shredded cheese on top of the cilantro chutney, then top with about 1/3 cup of the potato mixture, using the back of a spoon to press it down, and then place the remaining slice of bread (apple butter chutney side down) on top. Use a spatula to gently press the sandwich down and continue to cook until both sides are golden. To help the cheese melt, cover the pan with a melting dome. Repeat with remaining ingredients and add butter as needed to the pan.
13. Top the potato mixture with a few spoonfuls of the sweet chutney and top with another slice of cheese.
14. Serve the sandwiches hot, and enjoy!

name: Samosa Pinwheels (Baked)
instructions:
1. Boil potatoes or use microwave method to cook. Microwave method: Pierce potatoes with a fork about 4 times on each side. Wrap potatoes in moist paper towels. Microwave for 5 minutes on each side. Let cool, peel and mash lightly.
2. Temper spices: Heat oil in pan on medium and add cumin once oil is hot. After about a minute add asofoetida. Now add curry leaves then ginger. Put on low-medium and cook for 1-2 minutes, keep mixing so it doesn't burn.
3. Add potato mash/peas to pan and add remaining ingredients mixingthoroughly. Cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Turn off stove and add 1/2 cup coriander (optional) and mix. Let mixture cool
4. Prepare puff pastry: Cut puff pastry in half. Flour working area and roll out 1 puff pastry to about 12 inches in length and 6 inches in width
5. Make pinwheels: Take half of mixture and spread layer evenly across puff pastryleaving about an inch at one end (long side). Roll pastry up across the longend. Wrap roll in plastic wrap and freeze for about 10-15 minutes. Then, take out roll and cut into 1/2 inch pieces
6. Bake pinwheels: Preheat oven to 400F. Assemble pinwheels on baking sheeting leaving a little room as they expand. Bake for about 20-25 minutes until golden brown
7. Serve and enjoy them while they are hot! Note: directions are for half of the puff pastry and mix, repeat to finish baking all the pinwheels

name: Sheet Pan Black Bean Quesadillas
ingredients: Salsa, cilantro, sour cream, guacamole, optional
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet. They can overlap a little. Spread 1 tablespoon of pumpkin puree on half of each tortilla. (You'll leave one half empty so you can fold it over to make a half-moon shape.)
3. Top puree with ¼ cup beans, ¼ cheese, and a sprinkle of cumin.
4. Bake for 5- 7 minutes or until heated through and melty. Fold the empty side of the tortilla over and press down. Flip over and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes and remove from the oven.
5. Cut with kitchen shears and serve with desired dippings.

name: Sheet Pan Black Bean Quesadillas with Coleslaw
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet. They can overlap a little. Spread 1 mashed avocado on half of each tortilla. (You'll leave one half empty so you can fold it over to make a half-moon shape.)
3. Top puree with ¼ cup beans, ¼ cheese, and a sprinkle of cumin.
4. Bake for 5- 7 minutes or until heated through and melty. Fold the empty side of the tortilla over and press down. Flip over and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes and remove from the oven.
5. While in the oven, take the coleslaw mix, rinse with water and drain well.
6. Add some mayo, lime juice, salt, red chili powder and garlic powder.
7. Serve quesadillas with side of coleslaw.
8. Alternative to coleslaw:Cucumber, tomatoes, oil, vinegar or lime juice, salt and pepper to taste with some cilantro

name: Sheet Pan Coconut Vegetable Curry
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400.
2. Whisk together 1 cup coconut milk, 2 tablespoons green curry paste, and 4 cloves sliced garlic.
3. On a foil-lined baking sheet, arrange chopped cauliflower and chopped sweet potato. Scatter over 1/2 cup basmati rice.
4. Pour over the coconut milk mixture, then whisk 2 tablespoons peanut butter with 1 cup boiling water, and pour over. Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove foil, add kale, salt, and pepper, then reseal and bake for 5 more minutes.
5. Remove from oven and let sit for 3 minutes. Serve with fresh cilantro, chopped peanuts, and lime.
6. Make on a sheet pan to serve 4. To serve 2, halve the recipe and make in a skillet.

name: Shiro Wot (Ground-Chickpea Stew)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons homemade or store-bought berbere spice mix
instructions:
1. Place the onion and garlic in a food processor, and pulse until very finely minced, stopping periodically to scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula to ensure even chopping. Set aside.
2. Set a large Dutch oven or similar pot over medium-low heat. When the pot is warm, add oil, onion purée, 2 tablespoons berbere and a large pinch of salt. Stir to combine, then cover pot, and let aromatics cook gently while you prepare tomatoes.
3. Place tomatoes in the food processor, and pulse until puréed. Add to onion mixture, and increase heat to high. When mixture boils, reduce heat to low, and whisk in chickpea flour. The mixture will be quite thick, like peanut butter. While stirring, slowly pour in 2 cups water in a thin stream to loosen the mixture. Keep stirring until the mixture becomes smooth and integrated.
4. Increase heat to medium-high to bring shiro to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer for about 5 minutes to cook off the raw taste of the chickpea flour and integrate all the flavors. Stir in the jalapeños and season to taste with salt.
5. Serve immediately. (Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a few days. Store unused berbere in a cool, dark place for up to 3 months.)

name: Simple Vegetarian Slow-Cooked Beans
ingredients: 4cans(15-1/2 ounces each) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1cupoil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, patted dry and chopped
instructions: 1. In a 3-qt. slow cooker, combine the first 7 ingredients. Cook, covered, on low 4-5 hours or until carrots are tender, adding spinach and tomatoes during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Stir in cilantro and parsley.

name: Six-Bean Chili
ingredients: 1can(16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1can(15-1/2 ounces) navy beans, rinsed and drained
1can(15-1/2 ounces) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1can(15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1can(15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
2cans(14-1/2 ounces each ) fire-roasted diced tomatoes, undrained
instructions: 1. In a 6- or 7-qt. slow cooker, combine first 16 ingredients. Cook, covered, on low until vegetables are tender, 6-8 hours. If desired, serve with avocado.

name: Snake Gourd Kootu
instructions:
1. Soak chana dal in water for 1 hour.
2. Clean and cut the snake gourd to your desired size cubes. I chopped little fine.
3. Take both the dals in a small pressure cooker and just add enough water to immerse the dal. Add turmeric and stir well.
4. Add the chopped veggie over it (don’t stir)
5. Pressure cook for 3 whistles in medium flame. Allow pressure to release naturally.
6. Add kootu powder and salt and bring to boil for a few minutes.
7. Add tempering items: mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves.

name: So Good Chickpea Blondies
ingredients: ½cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips (chopped or mini chocolate chips)
instructions:
1. Here’s a peak at how to make this recipe so you know what to expect from the process. Scroll down to the bottom of the post for the full information including the timing and amounts.
2. Rinse and drain the chickpeas.
