3. Add to the food processor with the rest of the ingredients except the flour and chocolate chips. Grind well. Pulse in the flour and chocolate.
4. Spread into a pan.
5. Bake until golden around the edges and just firm.
6. No, but I will say that they are best when you make sure to grind up the batter as smooth as possible for the best final texture.
7. You can use sunflower seed butter instead of the peanut butter if you prefer.
8. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days. I prefer them chilled, but they are fine at any temperature.
9. Be sure to use a very ripe banana for the best flavor.
10. These are not super sweet, so add up to ¼ cup sugar to the batter if desired.
11. Use honey instead of maple syrup if needed.
12. Use almond butter or sunflower seed butter instead of the peanut butter.
13. Use a gluten-free cup for cup flour blend instead of all purpose if desired.
14. Make them nut-free with sunflower seed butter.
15. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and grease an 8×8-inch pan with nonstick spray.
16. Add the chickpeas to a colander to drain. Rinse with water. Drain.
17. Add to a food processor with the banana, peanut butter, maple syrup, vanilla, salt, and baking soda. Grind on high to make a uniformly smooth batter. (It might take 15-30 seconds.)
18. Pulse in the flour and chocolate until just combined.
19. Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 24-26 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden brown and the top is firm to the touch.
20. Let cool fully in the pan and slice to serve.

name: So Good Spinach Egg Muffins
instructions:
1. PrepChop spinach roughly
2. CookPreheat the oven to 375 degrees and grease a mini muffin tin.
3. Add the eggs to a medium bowl.Add spinach and rest of ingredients to the bowl with the eggs and stir.Use italian seasoning or garlic powder in place of cumin for flavor variety.
4. Divide among the prepared mini muffin tin, using about 1 tablespoon batter in each cup.
5. Bake for 14-16 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the tops are firm.
6. Place the muffin tin on a wire rack and let muffins cool in the tin for 5-10 minutes.
7. As they cool, they will start to pull away from the sides of the pan slightly. Use a paring knife around the edges to gently loosen and remove the muffins from the pan.
8. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serve with fruit and crackers, toast, muffin or salad.
9. You can store these in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months.

name: Soft and Chewy White Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions:
1. Now, if you like your cookie a little crunchier, you can bake these cookies a tad longer in the oven. A crunchy cookie is great to dunk in milk or in a warm cup of hot chocolate.
2. Would you rather have Macadamia Nuts in them? You could always add them to this recipe or you could try this cookie recipe here.
3. Cream all of the ingredients together.
4. To make this cookie recipe: simply mix sugars, softened butter and egg together in medium bowl. (Remember, my favorite bowl is no more. I still mourn the loss.)
5. Then mix in the dry ingredients. Stir well and put on cookie sheet (ungreased).
6. Then bake and serve. Delicious and easy!
7. Yes, you do. Too little or too much of the brown sugar will drastically result in cookies that don't turn out right. Be sure to measure the brown sugar carefully.
8. I would cook them for 12-15 minutes and go from there.
9. Wait! 365 degrees? Why?
10. Good question! I found that one of the secrets to these cookies is 365 degrees is the perfect. 375 degrees is too high and 350 degrees is too low.
11. I personally think this cookie recipe is the best for soft and chewy cookies and I urge you to try it.
12. You will probably never use another cookie recipe again.
13. Cream together butter, sugars and egg in a large bowl
14. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt
15. Fold in white chocolate chips
16. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet
17. Bake at 365* for 8 minutes or until done
18. Preheat oven to 365°

name: Soft Roasted Chickpeas
ingredients: 114.5- ounce can chickpeas rinsed, drained, and patted dry (or about 2 cups cooked dried)
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
2. If desired, rub the chickpeas in a clean kitchen towel to remove the skins. (You don’t have to do this, but you may want to if you have a toddler who’s particularly sensitive to textures.) Discard the skins
3. Stir together all ingredients in a medium bowl. Spread on a baking sheet or baking dish and bake for 12-15 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature, smashing beans slightly for younger eaters if desired.

name: Southwest Corn Chowder (Freezer Meal Prep)
instructions:
1. Meal Prep InstructionsLabel your gallon-sized freezer bag. Make sure to include name, instructions, and a use-by date (I recommend 90 days after prep date).Add all of the ingredients (except for the coconut milk, and broth) to a freezer bag. Stir gently to combine.Remove air, seal, and freeze.
2. Instant Pot InstructionsThaw the freezer meal overnight in the fridge.From thawed, add the coconut milk, and broth, stir to combine and then pressure cook on high for 10 minutes, then natural release for 10 minutes. Add salt as desired.
3. Use an immersion blender inside of the Instant Pot, or transfer 1/2 of the soup to a blender and blend until smooth. Return to Instant Pot.
4. Tip: Garnish with sliced jalapeno, freshly chopped tomatoes, and your favorite hot sauce.

name: Southwest Pasta Salad
instructions:
1. **Prep**Dice bell pepper, red onion, cilantro, scallionsCut cherry tomatoes, avocado
2. CookDrain and rinse black beans
3. Cook corn
4. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, chipotle peppers, minced cilantro, garlic powder, onion powder, chives, parsley, oregano, and lime juice. Set aside.
5. Cook the rotini according to the package instructions. Then, drain, rinse with cold water, and allow to dry for about 5 minutes.
6. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, black beans, corn, bell pepper, red onion, grape tomatoes, avocado, and chopped cilantro.
7. Pour in the chipotle dressing, and stir to fully coat the salad ingredients.
8. Add salt and pepper to taste.
9. Cover and place in the refrigerator, and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
10. Garnish with sliced scallions.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Pita with a Side of Greek Salad
instructions:
1. Prep:Roughly chop 2 cups of fresh spinach.
2. Combine the chopped spinach with 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese, 1/4 cup of finely chopped onions, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Mix well.
3. Cut 2-3 whole wheat pitas in half, creating pockets.
4. CookCarefully spoon the spinach and feta mixture into each pita pocket, being careful not to overfill.
5. In a large skillet or grill pan over medium heat, add a little olive oil. Cook the stuffed pitas for 2-3 minutes on each side, until the outsides are golden and the filling is warmed through.
6. Greek Salad Prep:Dice 1 cucumber, 2 tomatoes, and 1/4 of a red onion. Place them in a bowl.
7. Add 1/4 cup of kalamata olives and 1/4 cup of crumbled feta cheese to the vegetables.
8. In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 1 teaspoon of dried oregano, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
9. Combine and serve

name: Spinach-Cilantro Pesto
instructions:
1. Soak almonds to remove the skin.
2. In food processor, process the garlic and shallot. Once these are minced, add the almonds.
3. Next add the spinach, cilantro and sherry vinegar and continue to process until smooth.
4. Slowly add the olive oil until a thick pesto is formed, then salt to taste.

name: Spinach Puffs
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions:
1. Cut and saute spinach until wilted. Squeeze out any remaining water.
2. Take puff pastry out to thaw on counter.
3. Mix spinach, feta, onion, oil, dill and garlic in a medium bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, beat 1 egg to blend; fold into spinach mixture.
4. Preheat oven to 400°.
5. Roll out pastry on lightly floured surface.
6. Cut out large squares and place one in each muffin cup, pressing into bottom and up sides and leaving corners pointing up.
7. Divide filling among cups. Fold pastry over filling, pressing corners together to meet in center.
8. Beat second egg to blend in a small bowl. Brush pastry with egg wash (this will give the pastry a nice sheen). Alternatively use oil or butter here instead.
9. Bake until pastry is golden brown and puffed, about 25 minutes.
10. Let them cool on counter for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Spinach White Bean Enchiladas
ingredients: Handful fresh chopped cilantro for garnish (optional) ($0.13)
instructions:
1. Toast the tortillas on each side in a dry skillet over medium-low heat until they are a slightly stiff and have browned just a bit on the edges. Stack them on a plate until ready to use. Toasting the tortillas increases the flavor and helps prevent them from cracking. Shred an 8oz. block of pepper jack cheese. Half will be used for the enchilada filling and half will be used for the sauce.
2. Defrost the frozen spinach in a microwave or take it out of the freezer before beginning to allow it time to defrost naturally. Squeeze as much moisture out of the thawed spinach as possible. Place the spinach in a large bowl. Rinse and drain the white beans, then add them to the bowl with the spinach. Also add 4oz. of the shredded cheese, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and a little freshly cracked pepper. Stir until the mixture is evenly combined.
3. Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Begin preparing the pepper jack sauce by adding the butter and minced garlic to a small sauce pot. Sauté the garlic in the butter for one minute over medium heat. Add the milk and cream cheese to the pot. Stir and heat until the cream cheese has fully melted into the milk and the mixture has thickened slightly. Season with salt. Begin adding the remaining shredded pepper jack, a handful at a time, and stirring it in until fully melted before adding more. Once all the cheese has been melted into the sauce, turn the heat off and allow it to cool slightly.
4. Coat the inside of a casserole dish with non-stick spray. Begin filling the toasted tortillas with the spinach and white bean mixture and rolling them closed. Line up the filled tortillas in the casserole dish, seam sides facing down. Choose a casserole dish that fits 12 of the rolled enchiladas snugly to help keep them from unrolling.
5. Once the tortillas are filled and in the casserole dish, pour the pepper jack sauce over top. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges of the tortillas are brown and the pepper jack sauce is thick and browned on the edges. Sprinkle chopped cilantro over top, if desired.

name: Stir Fry
instructions:
1. Check the infographic here: https://www.cooksmarts.com/articles/guide-to-stir-frying/
2. Choose a protein (1 pound)Tofu: cubed, extra firmSeiten: choppedTempeh: chopped
3. Choose aromatics (1 tablespoon)Garlic, shallots, green onions, ginger
4. Prep vegetables (4 cups)Onions - thinly slicedBell peppers - slicedCarrots - thinly slicedBroccoli - chopped and microwaved with damp paper towel for 2 minutesBaby spinachFrozen peas, edamame or cornSugar snap peas, trimmed and left wholeBean sproutsMushrooms - slicedGreen beans - trimmedBaby corn - drained and rinsed
5. Make the sauceOptions listed in infographic: https://www.cooksmarts.com/articles/guide-to-stir-frying/
6. Make the stir fryHeat a wok over medium high heat.
7. Once hot, add 2 tbsp sesame oil and protein and let sit for 4 minutes before tossing to coat in oil.
8. Saute until tofu is golden, remove from pan and set aside.
9. Wipe wok with paper towel if needed, return to medium-high heat.
10. Add cooking oil and aromatics (garlic, shallots, green onion, ginger).
11. Once you can smell them, add veggies to heated oil with sprinkle of salt.
12. Stir fry for 10 minutes until tender but still crunchy. If pan ever looks too dry, add splash of water or broth
13. Add protein back to wok, push all ingredients to sides forming a hole int he middle.
14. Place sauce in the hole, wait for it to bubble and darken before tossing everything through and making sure ll the ingredients are coated.
15. Cook until all ingredients are tender, then remove from heat.
16. Garnish with lemon juice, salt, cilantro, basil, green onion, cashews or peanuts.

name: Strawberry Muffins
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
2. Lightly beat milk, oil, and egg in a small bowl.
3. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
4. Toss in chopped strawberries and stir to coat with flour.
5. Fold in the milk mixture until just combined.  Can add in some vanilla extract too if desired.
6. Divide batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the tops bounce back from the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Strawberry Spinach Feta Salad
instructions:
1. Add all of the ingredients for the salad to a large bowl.
2. In a small bowl or jar, mix together the dressing ingredients.
3. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss. Start by using half of the dressing and then add more depending on personal preference.

name: Sweet and Sour Quinoa
instructions:
1. Heat oil in pan over medium / high heat. Reduce heat and gently fry the onion until softened (approx. 5 mins). Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a further min.
2. Add the vinegar, soy sauce, tomato paste, pineapple juice, water and quinoa and then stir to combine.
3. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and allow to simmer for 15 mins, until the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Turn the heat off, fluff with a fork, replace lid and leave the quinoa to sit for a further 5 mins.
5. Stir in the chopped pineapple and serve

name: Sweet Potato Black Bean Quesadilla
ingredients: 1/2 cup frozen corn (or canned corn, drained)
1/2 cup cooked black beans (or canned, rinsed and drained)
1/2 cup grated cheese (like mozzarella or cheddar)
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
Optional: finely chopped onion, capsicum, green chili, or coriander leaves
instructions:
Prep:
Peel and chop 1 sweet potato into small cubes.
Boil or steam the cubes until soft (about 10–15 minutes), then mash well.
If using frozen corn, rinse under warm water to thaw.
Rinse and drain 1/2 cup canned black beans if using.
Optional: Finely chop 1 small onion or capsicum if adding.
🔥 Cook:
Make the filling:
In a bowl, mix the mashed sweet potato, corn, black beans, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add any optional veggies or herbs now.
Mix until well combined.
Assemble the quesadillas:
Place one tortilla on a plate or board.
Spread 2–3 tablespoons of the filling on half of the tortilla.
Sprinkle some grated cheese over the filling.
Fold the tortilla in half to close.
Cook the quesadillas:
Heat a pan on medium heat. Add a few drops of oil or ghee.
Place the folded quesadilla in the pan. Cook for 2–3 minutes on each side, until golden brown and the cheese melts.
Repeat with the rest.
Serve:
Cut into wedges and serve hot with chutney, salsa, or curd.

name: Sweet Potato, Tofu & Chickpea Curry
instructions:
1. Original recipe makes 3 servings
2. PrepPreheat oven to 200°C.
3. Chop cauliflower and season with cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt and pepper.
4. Dice sweet potatoes and season with cumin, paprika, coriander, cinnamon.
5. Cross score butternut squash.
6. Put all of them into the oven for 30-35 minutes until they're well roasted (golden color).
7. Combine tofu with marinade ingredients (olive oil, nutritional yeast, curry powder, garlic powder, salt, lemon juice) and refrigerate.
8. After removing vegetables from oven, bake marinated tofu on the same tray for 10-15 minutes until slightly charred.
9. Allow squash to cool.  Then combine with cashews, silken tofu, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, with a little water into creamy sauce.
10. CookToast cumin and coriander seeds, then grind.
11. Fry in oil, add onions and salt, cooking until softened.
12. Add ginger, garlic, chili.
13. Add tomatoes and another pinch of salt. Cook until dark red.
14. Add chickpeas and vegetable stock, bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes.
15. Mix most of the roasted vegetables into the chickpea mixture, reserving some for garnish.
16. Add in tofu and serve with bread.

name: Sweet Potato, Tofu & Chickpea Curry (Make Sauce Ahead)
ingredients: Nutritional yeast (1/3 cup + extra for seasoning)
instructions:
1. Original recipe makes 3 servings
2. PrepPreheat oven to 450
3. Chop cauliflower and season with cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt and pepper.
4. Dice sweet potatoes and season with cumin, paprika, coriander, cinnamon.
5. Cross score butternut squash.
6. Put all of them into the oven for 30-35 minutes until they're well roasted (golden color).
7. Combine tofu with marinade ingredients (olive oil, nutritional yeast, curry powder, garlic powder, salt, lemon juice) and refrigerate.
8. After removing vegetables from oven, bake marinated tofu on the same tray for 10-15 minutes until slightly charred.
9. Allow squash to cool.  Then combine with cashews, silken tofu, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, with a little water into creamy sauce.
10. CookToast cumin and coriander seeds, then grind.
11. Fry in oil, add onions and salt, cooking until softened.
12. Add ginger, garlic, chili.
13. Add tomatoes and another pinch of salt. Cook until dark red.
14. Add chickpeas and vegetable stock, bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes.
15. Mix most of the roasted vegetables into the chickpea mixture, reserving some for garnish.
16. Add in tofu and serve with bread.

name: Sweet Potatoes with Thai Peanut Butter Sauce
instructions:
1. Cook the sweet potatoes.
2. Make the slaw: Thinly slice the red cabbage, enough for 3 cups. Thinly slice the peppers. Thinly slice the green onion. Chop the cilantro. In a large bowl, mix together the cabbage, peppers, green onion and cilantro with the lime juice and kosher salt.
3. Make the Thai peanut butter sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, maple syrup, and water. Taste and add a bit of kosher salt if desired (this depends on the salt content of the peanut butter).
4. Serve: Slice the sweet potatoes in half and top them with the slaw. Drizzle with the Thai peanut butter sauce and sprinkle with chopped peanuts.

name: Sweet Spinach Muffins with Banana
ingredients: 2 tablespoons melted and cooled butter or yogurt
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and grease a muffin tin well with nonstick spray.
2. Place all ingredients into a blender except the flour and chocolate chips, if using.
3. Blend until very smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowls as needed. You want the greens to be very finely blended in so the batter is green, as if you were making a smoothie.
4. Pulse in the flour just to combine, or stir it in gently.
5. Pour batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about ¾ cup full. Sprinkle with chocolate chips if using.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until firm to the touch and lightly browned around the edges. (You can also check to see if a cake tester inserted into the center comes out cleanly.)
7. Remove from the oven and use a paring knife, if needed, to transfer to a wire rack to cool.
8. Serve slightly warm, at room temp, or chilled.
9. You can store the muffins in an airtight container in the fridge for 3-5 days and eat cold or slightly warmed. Or store in a zip top bag in the freezer for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the fridge or at room temperature.

name: Tandoori Veggie Quesadillas
instructions:
1. Set corn to cook in microwave.
2. Dice peppers and onion.
3. Set up rotimatic if using. Adults need 3-4, kids need 2-3.
4. Heat a large wide skillet over medium high heat. Add oil. Once oil is hot add the cumin seeds and let splutter for about 10-15 seconds.
5. Add the sliced peppers and onions and sauté until slightly softened (about 4-5 minutes)
6. Drain the cooked corn and let it cool.
7. Add garlic, dry seasonings, and salt to the pan - reduce heat to low so the spices do not burn.
8. Add corn, cilantro and stir well. Taste test for spice and salt levels. Remove from heat.
9. Mix cream cheese and Sriracha sauce.
10. In a large pan heat up a little bit of oil and add one tortilla spread with a layer of the cream cheese mixture.
11. Top with cheese, a few spoonfuls of the veggie filling, additional cheese and fold the tortilla over.
12. Press in panini/sandwich maker for 1 minute. Remove from heat, cut and serve hot!

name: Tangy Cucumber Salad
ingredients: 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more as needed
instructions:
1. Place the vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, and a few grinds of pepper in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Thinly slice the cucumbers crosswise. Place them in the bowl, add the chives, and toss to combine.
2. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight to allow the flavors to meld. Taste and season with salt and pepper as needed before serving.

name: Thai Curry Pizza with Naan Bread
ingredients: 15 ounces Muir Glen crushed fire-roasted tomatoes
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 450°F. Place naan directly on the oven grate and pre-bake 3 to 4 minutes per side until crisp.
2. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine Muir Glen crushed fire-roasted tomatoes with red curry paste, Sriracha, and a few pinches of kosher salt.
3. Thinly slice the red pepper. Thinly slice the green onions.
4. When the naan is ready, spread each with the tomato mixture, then top with mozzarella cheese, vegetables, cashews, and a sprinkle of kosher salt. Bake for 5 minutes, until the cheese is melted.
5. Meanwhile, chop the cilantro. Remove the pizza from the oven and garnish with a few cilantro leaves. Slice and serve immediately.

name: Tofu Scramble (Freezer Meal Prep)
instructions:
1. Meal Prep Instructions:Label your gallon-sized freezer bag with the name, instructions, and a use-by date (recommended 90 days after prep date).Add all ingredients (except for the maple syrup and fresh kale/spinach) to the freezer bag.Stir gently to combine the ingredients.Remove air, seal the bag, and freeze.Cooking Instructions:
2. Instant Pot Instructions:
3. Thaw the freezer meal overnight in the fridge.From thawed, stir to combine and then pressure cook on high for 3 minutes. Use the Quick-release function after cooking.Open the Instant Pot and add the maple syrup and fresh kale or spinach. Stir to combine.Add salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste.
4. Serving Tips:Serve with fresh greens, toast, or sliced tomatoes with chives.

name: Tomato Rice
ingredients: 1 tablespoon oil (preferably sesame or any cooking oil)
1 dried red chili, broken into pieces
1 tablespoon tamarind concentrate (or soak a lemon-sized tamarind in 1 cup warm water and extract juice)
1½teaspoons sambar powder (or 1 teaspoon coriander powder + ½ teaspoon chili powder)
½teaspoon jaggery or sugar (optional, to balance tanginess)
instructions:
1. Prep:Chop 1 small onion and 1 medium tomato.
2. If using tamarind instead of concentrate, soak and extract juice.
3. Soak 1 cup rice for 20 minutes, then drain.
4. Mix 1 teaspoon rice flour in 2 tablespoons water and keep aside (if using).
5. Cook:Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pressure cooker. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds and let them splutter.
6. Add 1 teaspoon chana dal, 1 teaspoon urad dal, 1 dried red chili (broken), and a few curry leaves. Fry until the dals turn golden.
7. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft and slightly golden.
8. Add the chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft and mushy.
9. Add 1½ teaspoons sambar powder, ¼ teaspoon turmeric powder, and salt to taste. Stir well.
10. Add the tamarind concentrate mixed with 2 cups water (or your tamarind extract). Let it boil.
11. Add the soaked and drained rice. Mix well.
12. Add 2 tablespoons grated coconut, 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves, and 2 tablespoons chopped mint leaves (if using).
13. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 2 whistles on medium heat. Then turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally.
14. Once the pressure has released, open the lid and add ½ teaspoon jaggery or sugar to balance the tanginess. Mix gently.

name: Tortellini Primavera
ingredients: 4cupschopped vegetables, such as broccoli, carrots and snap peas, or 16-ounce bag frozen mixed vegetables
instructions:
1. Put a large pot of water on to boil.
2. Meanwhile, whisk broth and flour in a small bowl. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, until just beginning to brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the broth mixture to the pan, bring to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in cheese, tarragon (or dill or chives) and salt.
3. Add vegetables and tortellini to the boiling water; return the water to a simmer and cook until the vegetables and tortellini are tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain; add to the pan with the sauce and stir to coat.

name: Vegan Chocolate Mousse
ingredients: 14.5- ounce can full-fat coconut milk (or coconut cream)
1-2 tablespoons powdered sugar (or honey or maple syrup)
instructions:
1. AD
2. Spoon the top solid part of the coconut milk into a medium bowl. (Use the remaining liquid part for a future smoothie.) For the result to be super creamy, we want only the firm solids of the coconut milk.
3. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir well to combine thoroughly. Sweeten to taste as you like.
4. Serve the mixture soft with its pudding-like texture or refrigerate briefly to firm up into a more solid mousse.
5. AD
6. Spoon the top solid part of the coconut milk into a medium bowl. (Use the remaining liquid part for a future smoothie.)
7. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir well to combine thoroughly.
8. Serve the mixture soft with its pudding-like texture or refrigerate briefly to firm up into a more solid mousse.

name: Vegan Lemon Pepper Tofu
instructions:
1. Night before: freeze the block of tofu until completely frozen. This changes the texture.
2. When ready to cook, thaw the tofu completely, then take it out of the package and drain it.
3. Press the tofu for 10-15 minutes to get any excess liquid out while you preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
4. Break the block of tofu into small pieces. The texture will be firm and meaty now so it will break apart into pieces easily.
5. Put the tofu into a large mixing bowl. Then sprinkle with cornstarch onto the tofu and toss to coat.
6. Now drizzle with the olive oil and toss so all of the tofu is wet with oil.
7. Then sprinkle with the lemon pepper and toss to coat. If your lemon pepper seasoning already has salt then you can skip it. If it doesn't have salt, add a few pinches to the bowl with the tofu.
8. Next, add the garlic to the bowl and toss one more time.
9. Place the tofu on a sheet pan, lined with parchment paper or sprayed with non-stick spray.
10. Bake for 10 minutes, flip the tofu and bake for another 10-15 minutes or until brown and crunchy.
11. Serve with any sides you want: steam broccoli, pasta, quinoa, etc.

name: Vegan Pad Thai
ingredients: 6-8 stalks Chinese chives cut into 2-inch long strips
instructions:
1. Pad Thai Sauce
2. Add the sugar to a light-colored saucepan or skillet. Heat over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until sugar has melted. Do not stir. Keep heating until the sugar gets a golden brown color and turns into caramel.
3. As soon as the sugar has caramelized, deglaze with the 2 tablespoons of water. Be careful as it will spit. Next, add the vegan fish sauce, sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, tamarind juice, and toasted rice powder if using. Let simmer for 1 minute, or until the caramel has melted. Transfer the sauce to a small bowl and set aside.
4. Pad Thai
5. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, cook the rice noodles according to the package instructions.
6. In the meantime, heat the oil in a skillet or wok over medium heat. Once hot, add the minced garlic and shallot, and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until fragrant.
7. Add the scrambled tofu and cook for another minute. At this point you can add a pinch of turmeric to give the tofu a yellow color, and a pinch of kala namak salt for an eggy taste.
8. Add the drained cooked noodles, bean sprouts, Chinese chives, and the sauce. Cook for 2-3 minute, stirring regularly to coat the noodles with the sauce.
9. Remove from heat, top with crushed peanuts, a squeeze of lime, and serve immediately. This Pad Thai will keep for up to 3 days in the refrigerator.

name: Vegan Spicy Thai Drunken Noodles with Seared Tofu
instructions:
1. PrepPress tofu thoroughly BEFORE cutting into cubes.
2. Mix amino/soy sauce, 2 tablespoons sriracha and lime juice together. Soak the cut tofu cubes in this marinade, cover and refrigerate for an hour.
3. Dice onions. Can also add bell pepper, broccoli, snow peas, carrot, or baby corn.
4. CookPlace all your rice noodles in a wide mixing bowl.
5. Bring 4 cups of water to boil.
6. Pour the boiling water over the rice noodles until they are completely submerged.
7. Stir to loosen the noodles every few minutes so they don't stick together.
8. When they are completely limp, give them a taste to see if they're cooked through.
9. Depending on thickness, the flat rice noodles might take upwards of ten minutes.
10. Pay attention and test the noodles frequently because they'll become mushy if they overcook.
11. The noodles are being stir-fried for the drunken noodles, so you want to under-cook them a bit.
12. They will absorb more moisture and cook the rest once in the stir fry. If your noodles are perfectly cooked to start, they will turn to mush in the stir fry.
13. Once the noodles are tender, drain them and run them under COLD water to stop the cooking.
14. Whisk Drunken Noodle sauce ingredients together (rice vinegar, broth, aminos/soy sauce, maple syrup, sriracha).
15. Pour sauce over noodles and let sit while you cook the tofu.
16. Heat wok to medium-high.
17. Add tofu and sauce, and sear tofu.
18. Put to the side.
19. Add veggies and garlic, and cook until translucent.
20. Add rice noodles, sauce and tofu back in.
21. Add 3/4 cup basil, reserving 1/4 cup for garnish.
22. Add noodles mixture to a bowl.
23. Sprinkle with extra basil.Serve with a wedge of lime and Sriracha

name: Vegan Sweet Potato Beetroot Hotdogs
instructions:
1. PrepSteam and mash beets and sweet potatoes separately. No lumps!Dice tomatoes and onion. Keep aside some sliced onion.Boil 1 cup of carrots & peas
2. CookSauté onions for 8 minutes then add ginger garlic paste.
3. Add the spices (salt, pepper, red chili flakes, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, kitchen king) and cook for 1 minutes
4. Add in the carrots & peas and chopped tomatoes and cook for about 3 minutes.
5. Add the mashed beetroot and cook it well for about 4-6 mins till it releases water.
6. Add 2 tbsp of flour and mix it. Cook well for about 3-4 minutes so that the flour cooks. You do not want raw flour taste.
7. Add the mashed sweet potato to the mixture and stir it in well.
8. Keep cooking on medium flame till the water in the mixture cooks off. The mixture should start holding its shape and doesn’t break apart. This can take 6-10 mins.
9. Let the mixture cool and then shape it to a hot dog shape with wet hands or gloves so it doesn’t stick to you.
10. Roll the shaped hot dogs in the panko/breadcrumbs.
11. Mix sliced onion with dry garlic powder, lemon sauce, and Chaat masala.

name: Vegetable Gyoza
ingredients: 1 package extra firm tofu (12 oz, 340 g)
1Tbspmiso (I recommend awase or red miso, as they have a bolder flavor than white miso)
80 gyoza wrappers (approximately; buy 2 packages of Myojo brand gyoza wrappers (52 wrappers per package); or make Homemade Gyoza Wrappers)
water (to fold and seal the wrappers)
toasted sesame oil (1 tsp per batch)
instructions:
1. To Drain the Tofu
2. Wrap 1 package extra firm tofu with a paper towel and place it on a tray/plate. Put another tray/plate on top of the tofu and press it down with a heavy object for roughly 30 minutes to 1 hour. (I pressed for 2 hours this time; my single tofu block weighed 400 g before pressing and 355 g after.) If you‘re in a hurry, you can microwave the tofu without plastic wrap for 1½ minutes (at 1000 watts) and drain the water.
3. To Mix the Seasonings
4. While you're waiting for the tofu to drain, mix the seasonings. In a small bowl, add 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp toasted sesame oil, 1 Tbsp miso, 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt, and ⅛ tsp white pepper powder.
5. Whisk it all together and set aside.
6. To Make the Filling
7. Discard the tough core of 2–3 leaves cabbage (green). Cut the leaves into julienned pieces.
8. Mince the julienned cabbage into small pieces. Tip: It‘s usually easier to tuck smaller pieces in the gyoza wrapper rather than chunkier pieces.
9. Repeat with ⅛ head red cabbage: Discard the tough core of the red cabbage leaves and cut the leaves into julienned pieces. Then, mince into small pieces.
10. Put the minced green and red cabbage in a bowl and add 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt. Rub the salt into the cabbage with your hands and set aside until it releases its liquid.
11. Cut 2 inches carrot into slabs, then sticks, and mince them.
12. Mince ½ onion finely: Lay the onion flat side down on the cutting board. With the knife tip pointing toward the root end, make ⅛-inch vertical slices to within ½ inch of the root end. Then, with the knife edge toward the root end, make ⅛-inch horizontal slices, again keeping the root intact. Finally, make perpendicular cuts down through the vertical slices you made.
13. Cut 2 green onions/scallions into white and green parts. Save the green part for garnish. Mince the white part into small pieces for the filling.
14. Cut off and discard the root end of 4 king oyster mushrooms (eringi). Cut the mushrooms into sticks and then mince them.
15. Discard the stems of 2 shiitake mushrooms. Cut the mushroom caps into strips, and then mince them.
16. To a large bowl, add the onion, two kinds of mushrooms, carrots, and white part of the green onions. Then, mince or press 1 clove garlic (I use my garlic press here) and add it to the bowl.
17. Peel and grate the ginger (I use a ceramic grater ). Measure 1 tsp ginger (grated, with juice) and add it to the filling ingredients.
18. Squeeze and discard the liquid from the cabbage. Add the cabbage to the bowl with the other ingredients.
19. Remove the paper towel and slice the tofu into thin slabs roughly ⅛ inch (3 mm) thickness (pencil width).
20. Next, cut the tofu slabs into sticks, and then cut the sticks into cubes.
21. Add the tofu cubes and the seasonings mixture to the bowl. Mix it all together. Once the ingredients are well coated with the seasonings, add 2 Tbsp potato starch or cornstarch and mix thoroughly. If the filling seems watery, add more potato starch to absorb any extra moisture.
22. To Fold the Gyoza
23. Prepare a tray or plate with parchment paper and sprinkle some potato starch (cornstarch). This will prevent the gyoza from sticking to the paper. Gather 80 gyoza wrappers and prepare a small bowl of water.
24. Take a wrapper and place it in the palm of your non-dominant hand. Use a teaspoon to scoop a small amount of filling and put it in the center of the wrapper. Dip one finger in the bowl of water and draw a circle around the outer ¼ inch (6 mm) of the wrapper with your wet finger until it’s moistened all around.
25. Here, I show you how to fold the gyoza with the pleats leaning toward the center. Fold the wrapper in half over the filling and pinch it in the center with your fingers, but don’t seal it yet. Using the thumb and index finger of your right hand, start making a pleat about every ¼ inch (6 mm) on the top part of the wrapper from the center toward the right side, making 3–4 pleats.
26. As you fold each pleat, press the folded pleat tightly against the back part of the wrapper using your other thumb and index finger. Make 3–4 pleats.
27. Continue with the left side of the gyoza. Making 3–4 pleats with your left hand, starting in the center and moving toward the left side.
28. Press the pleats tightly, making sure there are no air pockets. Shape the gyoza to look pretty. Repeat folding the remaining wrappers. Tip: See my Gyoza recipe for an alternative folding method where the pleats all lean toward one side.
29. To Freeze Uncooked (optional)
30. This recipe may make more gyoza than you wish to serve now. If you want to store some uncooked gyoza to cook later (optional), now is the time to freeze them. Before the filling starts to release moisture and make the wrappers soggy, cover the gyoza with plastic wrap and “flash freeze” them in the freezer until solid (or at least frozen on the outside). Make sure to lay out the gyoza in a single layer on a sheet pan or plate. Once the gyoza are solid, pack them in an airtight bag. Because you flash froze them, the gyoza won’t stick to each other in the bag. You can store the gyoza in the freezer for up to a month. When you‘re ready to use the gyoza, do not defrost them. Place the frozen gyoza in your frying pan and steam them for an extra 1–2 minutes.
31. To Cook the Gyoza
32. To cook the gyoza that you just folded, heat a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat. When the pan is hot, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil. Then, place the gyoza in a single layer, flat side down and without touching each other, in a circular pattern (or place them in two rows). You will need to cook the gyoza in batches. As you can see from the photo, my large frying pan can fit about 12–13 pieces per batch.
33. Cook until the bottoms of the gyoza turn golden brown, about 3 minutes. Next, add ¼ cup water to the pan.
34. Immediately cover with a lid and steam the gyoza for about 3 minutes or until most of the water evaporates. Tip: If you‘re cooking frozen gyoza, steam them for an extra 1–2 minutes.
35. Remove the lid to evaporate any remaining water. Drizzle 1 tsp toasted sesame oil around the gyoza in the frying pan. Cook, uncovered, until the bottom of the gyoza are golden brown and crisp.
36. To Serve:
37. Transfer the cooked gyoza to a plate. Repeat the process to cook the other batches. Serve the Vegetable Gyoza with a small bowl of dipping sauce for each person. To make the dipping sauce, combine 1 Tbsp rice vinegar (unseasoned), 1 Tbsp soy sauce, and ⅛ tsp la-yu (Japanese chili oil) in each dipping bowl and mix it all together.
38. Cut the green part of a green onion for garnish, if you‘d like.
39. To Store:
40. You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in the freezer for a month.

name: Vegetable Lasagna
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray and set aside.
2. Dice zucchini, bell pepper, onion and spinach.
3. In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Sauté veggies and garlic.
4. Use a separate bowl to stir together egg, parsley, basil, ricotta cheese, 1 ¼ cups mozzarella, and ¼ cup Parmesan.
5. When the vegetables are done cooking, stir the marinara sauce into the skillet.
6. Spread ¼ of the marinara-vegetable sauce mixture in a thin layer in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
7. Create layer of no-boil lasagna noodles, ⅓ of the ricotta mixture, and another ¼ of the sauce mixture.
8. Repeat layers two more times. Finish with remaining 1 cup of mozzarella and ¼ cup of Parmesan cheese on top. Cover with aluminum foil.
9. Bake for 35 minutes.
10. Remove foil, and bake for another 5-10 minutes (until cheese on top is browned).
11. Let stand for about 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Vegetarian Burrito Bowl with Avocado Crema
ingredients: 1cupextra long grain rice or basmati rice
instructions:
1. Make cilantro lime riceInstant Pot: 1 cup rice, 1 1/4 water, 1 tsp olive oil, salt
2. High pressure for 3 minutes, natural pressure release for 10 minutes. Total time should be roughly 20 minutes
3. Combine chopped cilantro, lime juice, and some more oil. Fluff rice with fork and toss the mix together.
4. Burrito BowlPreheat the oven to 400°F.
5. Chop cauliflower, bell peppers, onion. Drain black beans.
6. In a large bowl toss cauliflower, onion, and bell peppers with the taco seasoning, olive oil and lime juice then spread out on a large (rimmed) baking sheet.
7. Place on the center rack and bake for 30 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender with crispy edges.
8. While the vegetables are cooking prepare avocado crema by blending avocado, garlic, sour cream, salt, lime juice, cilantro until smooth. Also chop the lettuce.
9. In a small skillet combine black beans and salsa over medium heat and cook for 5 minutes, until warmed through.
10. Serve the roasted taco vegetables over cilantro rice, with the beans, lettuce and avocado crema.

name: Vegetarian Chili
instructions:
1. Dice yellow onion, sweet potatoes, red bell peppers.
2. Once the oil is hot, add the onion and cook until beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the sweet potatoes, bell pepper, garlic, chili powder, chipotle chili powder, cumin, and kosher salt.
4. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
5. Add 2.5 cups of the vegetable broth and the quinoa.
6. Pour the tomato sauce on top (do not stir again).
7. Cover and seal the Instant Pot. Cook on manual (HIGH) pressure for 8 minutes. Immediately release the pressure. Carefully open the Instant Pot.
8. Turn the Instant Pot to OFF. Stir in the black beans, kidney beans, and sugar. Place the lid back on top and let stand 10 minutes to thicken. Uncover. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Serve hot, with any and all the toppings!
9. Vegetarian chili is good in the refrigerator for 5 days and in the freezer for 3 months. Let the leftovers cool completely, and store them in an airtight container.
10. Can serve with salad, cornbread or roasted veggies

name: Vegetarian Enchiladas
ingredients: 15 oz. can of black beans, drained and rinsed
14.5 oz. can fire roasted, diced tomatoes
3cupssharp cheddar cheese, divided {or cheese of your choice}
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
2. In a large skillet heat the 2 Tablespoons olive oil over medium high heat. Add the bell pepper and onion and sauté until the onion is soft. Add the black beans, fire roasted tomatoes and diced chiles and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.
3. Spray a 9 x 13 inch dish with non-stick cooking spray. Place tortillas on a large plate or cutting board. Using a spoon place 2-3 spoonfuls of the black bean mixture into the center of the tortilla, a sprinkle of cheese and a drizzle of enchilada sauce and roll it until closed. Place seem side down in the dish. Continue to do all of the tortillas laying them side by side.
4. Drizzle the remaining enchilada sauce on top of the enchiladas followed by the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the enchiladas are heated through.
5. Remove from the oven and garnish with fresh cilantro, sour cream and avocado.

name: Vegetarian Tortilla Soup
instructions:
1. PrepPeel and dice the onion. Dice the green pepper. Peel and mince the garlic. Drain and rinse the beans.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil and sauté the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the green pepper and the garlic and sauté for 2 minutes.
4. Stir in the oregano and the cumin for 1 minute.
5. Add the tomatoes, beans, corn, adobo sauce, broth, and kosher salt.
6. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes.
7. Prep the garnishes: Slice the radishes. Slice the lime into wedges.
8. Serve: To serve, ladle the soup into bowls and allow to cool to warm. Garnish with the tortilla strips, radishes, torn cilantro leaves, hot sauce, and plenty of lime juice.

name: Veggie Marinara Sauce
ingredients: 3cupsonion, carrot, butternut squash, sweet potato, bell pepper (any color but green) celery, and/or cauliflower (roughly chopped)
29 ounces canned diced tomatoes with juices
instructions:
1. Gather your ingredients.
2. Cook the veggies in olive oil until soft, then add the tomatoes and simmer until the veggies are soft.
3. Puree or leave chunky, depending on how your family likes their pasta sauce.
4. Serve with a pound of your favorite pasta.
5. How long can I store this marinara sauce recipe?
6. You can make a big batch of this on the weekend and store it in the fridge until you are ready to use it during the week, which is what I like to do when I’m on top of my meal planning. (That only happens sometimes!) It will last up to 5 days in an airtight container like a quart-size Mason jar.
7. You can also let it cool and store it in a freezer safe container in the freezer for at least 3 months. Let it thaw overnight in the fridge or use the defrost feature on your microwave to thaw more quickly.
8. Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the vegetables, stir, and cover. Cook for 10 minute or until mostly soft.
9. Remove lid and stir in the tomatoes. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to medium low and place the lid so it’s mostly covering the pot but not a tight seal. This will let some steam escape but will protect your cooktop from splatters. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until everything is soft.
10. Puree with an immersion blender or in a regular blender. Season to taste with additional salt as needed.
11. Serve with 1 pound of cooked pasta and Parmesan cheese, if desired.
12. Brown ½ pound ground beef or mild Italian sausage in Step 1 after you warm the oil. Proceed as directed.
13. To do this in a Slow Cooker:
14. Double all ingredient amounts and add to the slow cooker. Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or until everything is softened. Finish as directed in Step 3.
15. To make this into Pizza Sauce: Simmer the sauce for about 30-45 minutes longer on low, stirring occasionally, or until very thick. Add 1 teaspoon pizza seasoning.
16. Use veggies with colors like white, yellow, orange, and red that will blend together into a classic looking tomato sauce when combined with the canned tomatoes.
17. Double the recipe to make more and freeze the second half of the batch for a future week.
18. Use the same volume of diced fresh tomatoes, just simmer longer to allow the extra liquid to evaporate.
19. Serve with a pound of whichever kind of pasta your family prefers.
20. Add some protein to the pasta and sauce by adding canned white beans or chickpeas, warmed frozen peas, diced cooked chicken breast, meatballs, or even lentils.

name: Veggie Roti
instructions:
1. Peel and cube the veggie into small chunks for quick steaming and steam until soft (I do this on stove top so I just check using a fork).
2. Once steamed, mash it well using a fork or masher.
3. For the potato roti, heat some oil in a pan, add the mashed potatoes, salt, turmeric powder, kitchen king masala, Kashmiri chilli powder and garlic powder and mix it well for few mins.
4. Transfer this mixture to a bowl, knead it gently while adding wheat flour in small increments, oil, and more salt if needed.
5. Don’t over knead it, it is okay for the dough to be slightly sticky.Don't add any water.
6. You can start mixing using a spoon and then go in with your hand to avoid the mess.
7. For all other veggies, I don’t bring the mash back to the stove, I simply place the mash in a bowl, add the masalas and proceed to the kneading part.
8. Take saran warp and put it on your counter.
9. Oil it slightly - place a fairly big amount of dough ball , cover with another piece of cling wrap and roll into into a slightly thicker disc using a rolling pin.
10. Since the dough will be slightly sticky this method ensures it doesn’t stick when rolling or transferring to the tawa.
11. Transfer to the hot pan , transfer first from foil to hand and then to pan.
12. Roast well on both sides and apply ghee.

name: Veggie Upma
ingredients: 1 teaspoon urad dal (optional for a bit of crunch)
1 green chili, chopped (optional for mild spice)
A few curry leaves (if you have them)
¾ to 1 cup frozen mixed vegetables (like carrot, beans, peas, corn – no need to thaw)
instructions:
1. Prep:Finely chop 1 small onion and 1 green chili (if using).
2. Measure 1 cup rava and 2½ cups water.
3. Keep your frozen veggies ready (no need to thaw).
4. Cook:Heat a pan on medium heat. Add 1 cup rava and dry roast it for 3–4 minutes until it gives off a light nutty smell. Stir continuously so it doesn’t brown. Set aside.
5. In the same or another pan, heat 1 tablespoon oil or ghee. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds. Let them pop.
6. Add 1 teaspoon urad dal (if using), 1 chopped green chili, and a few curry leaves. Fry for a few seconds.
7. Add the chopped onion. Sauté until soft and slightly golden.
8. Add ¾ to 1 cup frozen mixed veggies straight into the pan. Cook for 2–3 minutes until they begin to soften.
9. Pour in 2½ cups water and add salt to taste. Bring it to a gentle boil.
10. Reduce the heat to low. Slowly add the roasted rava while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
11. Stir until the water is absorbed and the upma thickens (about 3–5 minutes). Cover and let it sit for 2 minutes.
12. Mix in chopped coriander, grated coconut, and a splash of lemon juice if you like.

name: Veggie Wrap
ingredients: Other veggie ideas: chopped tomato, corn, lettuce, beets, bell peppers
instructions:
1. Shred carrot and chop cucumber.
2. Spread hummus over tortilla.
3. Add edamame, spinach, avocado, carrot, cucumber, and any other desired vegetables.
4. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
5. Drizzle with a tiny bit of olive oil. Roll up your wrap and enjoy!
6. *I love using regular hummus or roasted red pepper!
7. **Other vegetable ideas: tomato, radish, corn, lettuce, cabbage, red bell pepper, zucchini, alfalfa sprouts etc.

name: Vetha Kozhumbu
instructions:
1. Prep:Chop 1 small onion (or peel 6–8 shallots).
2. Chop 1 medium tomato (if using).
3. Mix 1 teaspoon rice flour in 2 tablespoons water and keep aside.
4. If using tamarind instead of concentrate, soak and extract juice.
5. 🍲 Cook:Heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a pan. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
6. Add 1 teaspoon chana dal (optional), 1 teaspoon urad dal, 1 dried red chili (broken), and a few curry leaves. Fry for a few seconds till the dals turn golden.
7. Add the chopped onion (or shallots). Sauté until soft and slightly golden.
8. Add the chopped tomato. Cook until it turns soft and mushy.
9. Add 1½ teaspoons sambar powder, ¼ teaspoon turmeric powder, and salt to taste. Stir well.
10. Add 1 tablespoon tamarind concentrate mixed with 2 cups water (or your tamarind extract). Let it boil.
11. Cook on medium heat for 10–15 minutes until raw smell of tamarind fades and the gravy thickens slightly.
12. Add the rice flour slurry (if using) and stir. Simmer for 2–3 more minutes.

name: Whole Fruit Ice Pops
ingredients: 2cupsfruit (Pick one or a combo: watermelon, strawberries, mango, pineapple, or kiwi)
2 tablespoons apple juice (or full fat coconut milk, solids only, or plain whole milk yogurt)
instructions:
1. Here’s a look at the steps to make these popsicles. Scroll down to the end of the post for the full information and amounts.
2. Peel the fruit, if needed. Wash the fruit if not peeling it and dry it gently. Dice the fruit and measure it out.
3. Add to a blender. Add any optional ingredients.
4. Blend very smooth.
5. Use a funnel to pour into ice pop sleeves or add to a popsicle mold. Freeze for at least 4 hours.
6. AD
7. Add the ingredients to a blender. Blend until very smooth. Taste and adjust sweetness as desired.
8. Pour into ice pop sleeves or popsicle molds. Freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. Serve cold.
10. (To make without a blender, add ingredients to a wide bowl and mash coarsely with a potato masher.)

name: Zucchini and Paneer Waffles
instructions:
1. Shred the Zucchini and add salt to it and leave it for 10 minutes
2. Drain and squeeze the water out of the Zucchini
3. Add chopped cilantro and shredded paneer
4. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, amchur powder and salt only if needed
5. Add the rice flour and mix it well to form a thick batter (the longer the batter sits you may need more rice flour)
6. Grease the waffle maker with oil
7. Spread the batter on the waffle maker and cook for 10 minutes
8. Flip it mid way and cook on the other side
9. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve it along with Dill and Pepper Dip
